items.title: Head of Sales (Automotive) // Athena
items.content:
Head of Sales (Automotive) // Athena

Company: Athena

Tags:
  • Business Development
  • Customer Development
  • automotive
  • virtual reality

    • What we do

    Athena is a virtual reality tool for designing and testing experiences around the connected car. We combine the power of prototyping and the immersion of VR to create a whole new way of designing for automotive.

    As the Head of Sales (Automotive) you will work closely with our product team to develop the German automotive market. You are joining us in the middle of a super exciting go-to-market phase which equips you with the freedom AND responsibility to build an initial sales team and process.

    Why we do

    Cars are increasingly becoming a piece of software, a gadget, and a platform. Also the process of building cars gets closer to software development – more agile and human-centric. With OEMS transforming towards digital product companies, teams work on experiences around future mobility – beyond cars and beyond screen.

    How we do

    With Athena we developed a powerful tool for designers. VR Prototyping design enables design teams to communicate their work with stakeholders, test with actual users, and validate concepts in a fast and easy way. This accelerates production, avoids expensive mistakes, and allows validation along the way.

    Description

    Once you are here you will:

    … Contact inbound and outbound leads
    … Qualify and evaluate leads with a customer-centric approach
    … Provide value and keep the conversation going even when facing objections
    … Structure your deals and finalise proposals
    … Close and keep your commitments
    … Build your team and processes

    We expect

    • A minimum of 3 years working experience in software or automotive
    • A bachelor’s degree, or equivalent life experience
    • Broad range of sales and business development skills
    • Great leadership skills. We need someone who is confident with clients, leading presentations, workshops and mentoring talent
    • Ability to work in an ambiguous and dynamic environment, and in multidisciplinary teams
    • A willingness to get your hands dirty, and skills to also deliver outstanding results even on your own
    • A drive to stay on the pulse and contribute ideas for new features or ways to improve existing structures and products
    • A serious addiction to getting and giving feedback
    • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills in German required, as we target German Automotive companies
    • Experience or passion for the automotive world and design is a clear plus.
    • Absolute willingness to travel

    We offer 

    • Super inspiring work place in the heart of Kreuzberg
    • Coaching in the team and lots of learning opportunities
    • Help with relocation to Berlin, if not already based there
    • MacBook of choice, remote days and flex hours
    • Fair salaries and long list of perks (Conferences, Trainings, Books, Gadgets, Public Transportation and Fitness)
    • Additional opportunities to travel to Japan (HQ of Goodpatch)
    • Working with a fun, talented and international team that aims to create a caring and inclusive workplace

    We look forward to hearing from you!

    BTW:
    Athena is a product team within global design firm Goodpatch.
    https://goodpatch.com/

    Apply for this position

items.title: Engineering Manager
items.content:
Engineering Manager


Circleci


CircleCI is looking for a technology leader who brings exceptional management skills to our growing engineering organisation. We are looking for a leader well versed in managing engineering teams to guide our distributed teams as we scale and support them in continuously delivering business value. In this role you will challenge and support our engineers with the individual in mind. Your primary focus is your team and the people in it, and we expect you to build a great culture with diversity, inclusion, action orientation, and openness as our core values.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users.

See more jobs at Circleci

About CircleCI

About CircleCI

CircleCI is the best platform for software teams looking to rapidly build quality projects, at scale. Our intelligent continuous integration and delivery tools are simple yet powerful. Our aim is to provide the wisdom of a connected development ecosystem to every team member making technology decisions.

We run 7M+ builds a month on our platform for companies like Spotify, Kickstarter, Sony, and Coinbase. Over 25,000 organizations and 300,000 developers actively build, test, and deploy on CircleCI.  We’ve raised $59.5M in venture capital from Industry Ventures, Top Tier Capital, Scale Venture Partners, DFJ, Harrison Metal Capital, and Baseline Ventures.

CircleCI is a Bay Area Best Places to Work 2018 award winner. We offer our employees amazing health benefits, CircleCI stock options, and many other great perks - including daily catered lunch at the San Francisco office.

items.title: Project Manager
items.content:
Project Manager at Rose International

Remote | Freelance

Position Number: 295379
Location: Work at Home
Desired Skill Set: Project Management, Cloud

Position Description:
**C2C and STEM-OPT are not available**

**Only U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. can be considered as W2 candidates.**

Job Title: Project Lead/Manager

  • Start Date: ASAP
  • Duration: 16 months
  • Location: 4 Overlook Point, Lincolnshire, IL 60069

This project is currently in the pilot testing phase and the Project Lead/PM will take it through the global deployment to 120 countries.

  • Responsible as the project lead/project manager for the overall Microsoft vNEXT (Exchange, Skype, OneDrive, SharePoint, Office-365, Office-2016) coordination, status reporting and stability of project oriented work efforts.
  • Establishes and implements project management processes and methodologies for the IT community to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, adhere to high quality standards and meet customer expectations.
  • Responsible for assembling project plans and teamwork assignments, directing and monitoring work efforts on a daily basis, identifying resource needs, performing quality review; and escalating functional, quality, timeline issues appropriately.
  • Serve as a liaison between technical and non-technical team to ensure deliverables are met.
  • Manage projects with increased complexity, scope, budget. Works independently.
  • Candidate should have a background with vNEXT or leading/managing a MS O365 deployment.
  • Ideal candidate will understand the nuances of vNEXT.

Rose International is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender (expression or identity), national origin, arrest and conviction records, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Positions located in San Francisco and Los Angeles, California will be administered in accordance with their respective Fair Chance Ordinances.

Rose International has an official agreement (ID #132522), effective June 30, 2008, with the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, Employment Verification Program (E-Verify).

(Posting required by OCGA 13/10-91.)

items.content:
Engineering Manager


Achievement Network


Location: Flexible (Boston or East Coast preferred)

Position is available: Immediately

THE OPPORTUNITY

Reporting to the VP of Engineering, you will play a key role in crafting and implementing our technology vision for the organization.  The ideal candidate will be passionate about both coding and management, and will be highly motivated by projects that simplify, modularize, and improve existing features and systems which are critical to the function of the organization. This position will leverage technical experience, attention to detail, and a strong sense of process to manage engineers, and technical projects to success.

ANet is flexible to remote working with appropriate experience and a history of successfully collaborating with and mentoring other developers remotely. Occasional travel to ANet’s National Office in Boston will be necessary, so proximity to the New England area and eastern time zone is preferable.

WHAT YOU’LL DO


* Build, develop, and retain a high-performing and highly engaged team of engineers

* Work with members of the Product and Engineering teams  to plan projects,  measure progress, and ensure work  is completed in a timely way.

* Help scope solutions to meet both timing and  business requirement need

* Assist with release strategy; coordinate with other teams to deliver cross-team projects

* Identify, perform cost/benefit analysis, and advocate for promising areas of technical debt to address

* Identify bottlenecks or roadblocks to success of engineers and resolve yourself or raise to leadership team

* Actively  contribute to our codebase through technical tasks commensurate with experience & technical interests

* Embrace and model best practices including code reviews, regression testing, and CI/CD..

* Keep abreast of new technologies and propose adoption as appropriate.

* Champion ANet’s core values




WHO YOU ARE AND WHAT YOU BRING

In order to be successful in this role, candidates must demonstrate the following:


* You have direct experience with the following management skills:



* o         Managing Software Engineers

* o         Agile and Waterfall development processes



* You have recent hands-on experience developing software using:



* Cloud-based infrastructure on AWS, including continuous integration and deployment

* RESTful Web Services

* Cloud-based data services, preferably with both SQL and NoSQL

* Java (preferred), Angular, and/or Go programming language

* Docker, database design, build & release processes & tool management



* You have an active interest in developing as a manager as well as continuing to code

* You are skilled in working closely with stakeholders to manage and design technology projects that meet the usability and functional needs of both internal and external users.

* You are a team player who motivates and educates colleagues; you enjoy working in a highly collaborative culture.

* You operate comfortably among a highly independent staff with diverse backgrounds.

* You bring an innovative approach to analyze, evaluate and solve problems.

* You are a skilled communicator

* You have a passionate commitment to and a sense of urgency for the support of schools, along with a belief that all students can achieve at high levels.

* You are motivated by working in an environment where we live out our core values daily and are eager to examine personal archetypes and biases while discussing topics related to race, class, and privilege which relate to ANet’s Advance Equity and People Matter values.




Preferred Qualifications:


* You have a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering or related degree

* For candidates interested in working remotely, you bring demonstrated experience and previous success working remotely




ANet is committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds and gender identities to apply to our positions.

See more jobs at Achievement Network

items.title: Experienced Engineering Manager ($90k - 140k)
items.content:
Experienced Engineering Manager ($90k - 140k)

Company: Citrusbyte

Job description

Have you spent the past five years managing software engineers?  

Do you have a proven track record of building teams that deliver complex software on-time and in-budget?

Are you ready to take your career to the next level and work with the best engineers on the planet? 

If so, we want to meet you!

Job Summary

We’re looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to join the team at Citrusbyte.

In this role, you will manage a team of 10 to 15 engineers operating in small squads of 4-5 engineers and work directly with Product, Research and Design teams as well as customer stakeholders and technical leads to build complex custom software applications.

Responsibilities and Duties

As an engineering manager supporting the development of a product, you are responsible for:

Strategy and Consulting

  • Run and / or participate in project kick-offs.
  • Work with your team to choose the tools, architecture, and platforms used to deliver client projects.
  • Define quality standards for client projects.

Hiring and Training

  • Attract, nurture, coach, and retain talent.
  • Ensure every assigned engineer has a career progression plan with regular check-in points and real-time feedback.
  • Ensure engineers are provided with continuous and valuable learning opportunities.
  • Contribute to determining engineering salary ranges and adjustments.
  • Contribute to defining and building the vision for our engineering organization.
  • Contribute to defining quality standards for our work.
  • Contribute to creating training and learning material and opportunities for engineers.

Managing and Directing

  • Talk to engineers to tease out concerns early, then fix them when possible.
  • Resolve conflicts or performance problems with engineers.
  • Embody the engineering culture and contribute to its advancement, inspiring everyone to live up to it.
  • Maintainer and contributor to our company engineering internal and public artifacts such as our quality standards and guidelines.
  • Represent the engineering organization with other departments and ensure we provide engineering support wherever necessary in the company.
  • Support team happiness.

Engineering and Delivery

  • Responsible for the quality and quantity of the engineering output.
  • Responsible for the continuous, iterative improvement of our engineering team.
  • Responsible for the overall planning, execution, and success of complex technical projects.
  • Work closely with product management team to ensure we're building the best products.
  • When necessary, act as Programmer, QA, Architect, PM, etc for short periods of time.

Benefits and Perks

100% REMOTE

TEAM RETREAT - Once a year the entire Citrusbyte team gest together at an inspiring location to meet, work and play.

HEALTHY BODY, HEALTHY MIND - HAPPY TEAM - We offer paid vacation and support healthy lifestyles through our physical fitness benefits program.

HEALTHCARE & FINANCE - We have comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans, plus we have a 401k plan.

How to apply:
citrusbyte.applytojob.com/apply/MkqxdH9RY5/Engineering-Manager

Apply now

About Achievement Network

WHO WE ARE

Achievement Network (ANet) is a nonprofit dedicated to educational equity. We help schools boost student learning with great teaching that’s grounded in standards, informed by data, and built on the successful practices of educators around the country. Founded in 2005, ANet now serves over 700 schools educating over 230,000 students across the country. Our support has consistently helped our partner schools—both district and charter—achieve breakthrough results for their students.

ANet has received multiple awards and recognitions, most recently receiving the highest ratings (Tier 1) on our math and ELA formative assessments from the  Louisiana Department of Education, the only organization to receive such high marks.  We were also named to The NonProfit Time’s “Best Nonprofits to Work For” and in the 2018-19 school year will be launching the Breakthrough Results Fund, a four-year collaboration to prove what’s possible in instructional improvement.

ANet is a dynamic, values driven, team-oriented organization that is committed to the growth and development of all staff members. Individuals who join ANet have the opportunity to join an exceptional team of colleagues committed to helping schools drive excellent teaching and learning by investing in each other and learning together.

Benefits

  • 80% Health, Dental, Vision
  • 3 Weeks Vacation
  • 10 Paid Holidays
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Retirement Plan Options
  • Flexible Spending Accounts
  • Short and Long-Term Disability Coverage
  • Basic Life and Personal Accident Insurance
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Commuter Benefits

items.content:
Technical Project Manager

McKinney, TX

full-time

Chargeback Gurus is a Fintech enterprise specializing in providing chargeback management, chargeback prevention, and fraud management for e-commerce businesses. We have over 100+ Gurus working all around the globe providing support to our e-commerce clients. Chargeback Gurus was recently rated as one of the fastest growing companies in 2017 by Inc. magazine.

We are a fast-paced firm and love to work with people who are fast, creative and smart. We are looking for the right Gurus to join our software development team. You will not be a number in our company. You will have the opportunity to meet with the founders, share your great ideas, be a part of bigger picture and identified as a core member of our group. If you think you have the Guru potential in you, please apply.

Responsibilities & Duties
  • Design enterprise level applications with multiple 3rd party APIintegrations.
  • Manage a distributed team working on different platforms and languages (Java/Python/Php) as well as different time-zones.
  • Lead the team, monitor code quality, assign peer code reviews and enforce best practices.
  • Check code for security issues and performance updates.
  • Acquire domain expertise quickly and document requirements.
  • Train new hires.
  • Use agile methodologies for managing the project and team.
  • Setup CI/CD environments and monitor build/deployment on AWS.
Qualifications & Required Skills
  • Expert in software engineering, preferably Java / Spring. Even though we do not expect this position to be coding, they must be able to analyze and review other’s work, serve as a mentor.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience as a Software Architect.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience leading a software team, engaging stakeholders, contributors and technical resources to analyze user needs and resource limitations.
  • Able to track and produce key metrics.
  • Agile experience/knowledge of key agile techniques.
  • Experience working with Atlassian project management tools (JIRA/Bitbucket/Confluence) or similar is a must.
  • Scrum master certification a plus, but not required.
Apply for this Job

items.content:
Engineering Manager

Developer
Anywhere
Company: InVision
Full Time

Overview

InVision is the digital product design platform used to make the world’s best customer experiences. We provide design tools and educational resources for teams to navigate  every stage of the product design process, from ideation to development. Today, more 4 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. That includes more than 80 percent of the Fortune 100, and organizations like Airbnb, Amazon, HBO, Netflix, Slack, Starbucks and Uber, who are now able to design better products, faster.

Our team is in search of an Engineering Manager to help us change the way digital products are designed.

About the Team:

You’re a builder. A builder of products and a builder of teams. You get a kick out of building resilient organizations, delivering high quality software that is meaningful to people, and creating a highly collaborative culture that fosters creativity and innovation. Your best week was one in which you were on vacation. Not because you don’t love your job (you do!), but because you built an organization that you know thrived while you were out. We believe deeply in the in which our leaders move forward with purpose and intent rather than seeking permission.

 leader-leader model

What you’ll do:
  • You will manage a team of 5-7 engineers
  • You will work with stakeholders from across the organization, from Product managers to Executives
  • Mentor and help engineers to plan and execute their career paths
  • Seek out and listen to the customer, and work with your team to create solutions that will have the highest impact
  • Create a culture of innovation on the team where ideas are generated and executed
  • Collaborate across the business to understand user needs, prioritizing new features, and communicating product roll-outs in partnership with your Product Manager
  • Iterate on your product and own its quality and impact to our customers, making key investments and improvements with your product and design partners
  • Maintain focus on operational excellence and on running the team’s services in production
  • Set context with the team so they are empowered and equipped to make great business- and Engineering-informed decisions

    • What you’ll bring:
    • Prior experience managing a team (or teams) of Engineers
    • A servant leader approach to leadership — we serve our teams, not the other way around
    • Passion for creating and mentoring engineering teams; you enjoy watching engineers learn and thrive in their careers
    • Bias towards action, absolute willingness to own the problem and drive towards a speedy solution; you won’t stop until the problem is solved with an effective solution
    • Keen eye for details and delivering quality products on tight timelines; you can motivate your team to find solutions which may be outside of the box, you approach problem spaces from many angles
    • Ability to comprehend and understand complex systems as a whole, and also to focus in and communicate relevant aspects of the system to non-technical stakeholders
    • Collaborative nature, with willingness and desire to work across multiple teams and departments; you can take all concerned parties into consideration and craft solutions which are win-win for everyone
    • Excellent verbal and written communications skills
    • Ability to thrive in a variable and demanding environment

      • About InVision:

      The company employs a diverse team all over the world. Each InVision team member is given the freedom and tools to do their best work from wherever they choose.

      InVision offers an incredibly unique work environment. 

      The benefits we offer in the United States and Canada include competitive health plans and a retirement plans. Some InVision-wide benefits offered to all employees across the globe include a flexible vacation policy, monthly coffee shop stipends, annual allowances for books related to your profession, and home office setup & wellness reimbursements. InVision is an international employer so some benefit offerings will vary from country to country.

      InVision is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.



      To apply for this job please visit the URL below.

      Please reference Jobspresso in your job application, so that remote companies know where their best candidates are coming from

      https://boards.greenhouse.io/invision/jobs/1336840 →

items.content:
Director of Engineering

Company: Creative Commons

The universe of openly licensed content is massive and growing, and we want to light it up — make it more discoverable, usable, and connected. This is the opportunity: to build products and services — both standalone and within our partner platforms — that will bring the commons to life with greater use, re-use, and contribution. Our primary product is CC Search.

There is no “front door” to the commons, and with over 1.4 billion works on over 9 million websites, the tools people need to curate, share, and remix works aren’t yet available. We launched CC Search in 2017, indexing about 1 percent of the commons, and a focus on images as a first media type. Today, CC’s dev capacity includes a four person tech team, who collaborate with our Director of Product and Research. The product is supported by multiple multi-year grants.

This project will unite hundreds of millions of records for works and metadata, multiple platforms, diverse media types, and a variety of user communities and partners. It’s a difficult but rewarding problem for an inspired and creative leader. We want to build this product as part of an open community, and create something useful, delightful, and essential to the work of creators, educators, scientists, cultural institutions, and our partners.

Primary Responsibilities

The Director of Engineering is part of the Tools and Product team, and reports to the CEO. You will lead the technical design, development and implementation of CC’s products and services. This is a rare opportunity to lead within an organization that is fundamental to sharing online, operating at a global scale. The successful candidate will lead a technical team to meet the needs of this vital organization, and to build a more vibrant, usable global commons, powered by collaboration and gratitude.

We believe that diverse teams build better organizations and better services. Applications from qualified candidates from all backgrounds, including those from under-represented communities, are encouraged and very welcome.  

The Director of Engineering leads the technology team to:

  • Develop, lead and implement an ambitious technical development strategy that is informed by, and aligned with, CC’s product strategy to bring CC Search and other relevant services to life
  • Manage and motivate our team of developers and designers to build innovative, robust software both for CC use and for public release
  • Work in the open and ship often, in public repositories, open chat rooms, public wikis and a global community
  • Work with the CEO, Director of Product and Research, and Director of Development (Fundraising) to seek funding for CC’s various technical projects
  • Represent the organization and provide technical leadership within various open communities and with CC partners. Coordinate with other outside communities, companies, and institutions to further Creative Commons’ mission, for example: W3C, non-profit communities like EFF, Open Knowledge, and Wikipedians, and the open data, open access, library, and open education communities.

Qualifications and requirements

  • Proven team and engineering leadership, and an entrepreneurial spirit: a collaborative, motivated self-starter
  • Demonstrated experience building and deploying large scale web services; experience on mobile is a plus; you’ve led teams before and know how to keep your eye on the big picture, while shipping incrementally and frequently
  • Ability to identify and scope user requirements and develop specifications
  • Excellent management, written, and oral communication skills
  • Familiarity with content licensing including Free/Open licenses a plus
  • Familiarity with consumer privacy
  • Fluent in one of Spanish, Arabic, or French (in addition to English) a plus
  • Desire to work in a diverse, global, highly collaborative team environment
 

Diversity

We believe that diverse teams build better organizations and better services. Applications from qualified candidates from all backgrounds, including those from under-represented communities, are very welcome. Creative Commons works as part of a global community, guided by collaboratively developed codes of conduct and anti-harassment policies.

Work Environment and Location

Creative Commons is a distributed organization. This position is available to applicants working in the range of the Eastern to Pacific time zones, in a remote working environment. You must have reasonable mobility for necessary travel, including twice-annual all-staff meetings and the Global Summit, and high-speed broadband access. Laptop/desktop computer and necessary resources are supplied.

Salary and Benefits

Creative Commons is a leading non-profit employer, offering competitive salaries and benefits, including health and wellness plans, annual retirement contributions, and a positive, supportive work environment. The salary range for this position is $110,000 to $140,000 USD, commensurate with relevant skills and experience.

How to apply:
Please email your cover letter and resume as a single PDF to “jobs@creativecommons.org” with the subject heading of “Director of Engineering / [Last Name].” No phone calls, please.

items.content:
Director of Engineering at NoRedInk

Remote | International

San Francisco or Remote – Pacific Time (PST) to Central European Time (CET)

NoRedInk is helping millions of students learn to write, and our free product has spread to more than 50% of US school districts, with students answering over 5 billion questions on our site. Long-time champions of functional programming, we have built the largest Elm code base in the world and a hybrid in-office/distributed team of accomplished, passionate engineers, including the creator of Elm. Our company’s mission is to unlock every writer’s potential, and we place a high value on empathy, growth mindset, inclusion, and relentless improvement.

We’re looking for an experienced engineering leader who’s operated and scaled a high-performing team, cares about tackling complex technical challenges, and maintains a high bar for talent and engineering practices.

Responsibilities

  • Report directly to the VP of Engineering
  • Hire, train, and manage a high-performing engineering team of 15-35, ensuring high engagement, productivity, and job satisfaction
  • Create the process infrastructure to help the company scale effectively
  • Lead with a tenacious work ethic, a bias toward action, and a philosophy of transparency and employee empowerment
  • Exemplify NoRedInk’s mission and values

About You

  • You have at least 3 years of engineering leadership experience, effectively managing engineering managers and multiple high-performing engineering teams
  • You understand the architectural scaling challenges that growing SaaS company face and are knowledgeable about effective strategies to overcome them
  • You have a servant-leader mindset, empowering team members by removing obstacles and helping them grow through coaching and mentorship
  • You’re excited about the opportunity to lead outstanding engineering teams whose members are distributed (locally in SF, across the US, and in places such as Berlin, Zurich, London, and Edinburgh).

What are we up to?

  • To see what our engineering team has been doing lately, check out our blog!

NoRedInk helps millions of students in grades 5-12 become better writers. Our adaptive curriculum guides learners through a continuous process of skill-building, feedback, and revision and delivers actionable performance data to teachers and administrators. Used in over 50% of school districts, we’re on a mission to unlock every writer’s potential. Here’s a 2-minute pitch we gave on NBC and articles about us in The Washington Post, Wall Street Journal, and Forbes.

Delivery Manager at CareCentrix

Remote

Job Locations: Remote | US-CT-Stamford | Remote

Job ID: 2018-5271

Category: Information Technology

Overview

This is a rare opportunity to help shape the future of healthcare and drive innovation throughout technology in the healthcare space.

The Delivery Manager will combine technical knowledge and hands-on skills to grow CareCentrix’s products and platform. The role will involve direct interaction with Product Management & Application Development teams to enhance and enrich the end user experience.

Candidate must have strong leadership, communication and technical skills as well as the ability to work well in a team environment. The ability to handle aggressive timelines is a must.

Responsibilities:

  • Act as Single Point of Contact (POC) of ingest for application ideas, enhancements, or issues.
  • Facilitate communication between Product Management/Application Development and Business teams.
  • Collaborate with Engineering, Product Development, and Client Services to ensure successful delivery of implementations within required timeframe and budget.
  • Works with business users to develop and execute work plans for system maintenance and enhancements. Conducts plan reviews and walkthroughs in an effort to communicate plans to other groups and to ensure the coordination and cooperation of all parties involved.
  • Work directly with our end users to troubleshoot L1 issues.
  • Triage production issues to internal stakeholders.
  • Standardize processes utilized by cross-functional teams.

  • Create and implement Service Level Agreements (SLA’s) to apply to all application users.

Qualifications:

  • Excellent communications skills both written and oral.
  • Self-motivated, high energy and a team player, who would take complete ownership of the project or module assigned.
  • Life cycle experience in large complex systems.
  • Must be able to deliver within short time frames.
  • Works well in fast-paced, changing environments.
  • Experience in at least 2 project management methodologies.
  • 5+ years of relevant SDLC project management experience.
  • 5+ years of experience running a team of 10 or more people.
  • Degree in Computer Science or Information Management or the equivalent, plus a minimum of 7 years of technical experience.

CareCentrix maintains a drug-free workplace in accordance with Florida’s Drug Free Workplace Law.

items.title: Perfect Keto: Marketing Project Manager
items.content:
Marketing Project Manager

Company: Perfect Keto
Headquarters: Austin, TX
https://www.perfectketo.com/

ROLE

Title: Marketing Project Manager

Location: Austin, TX or Remote

JOB OVERVIEW

Perfect Keto is seeking an organized, detail-oriented Marketing Project Manager with a proven track record of managing product launches, organizing team members and flawlessly executing to build bulletproof systems for promotions, campaigns, and marketing projects.

You can coordinate and manage a process including multiple players and moving pieces from start to finish flawlessly. You know what types of questions to ask and tests to perform to find holes and potential errors in process to catch them before they turn into costly mistakes.

Reports to: Sarah Peterson, VP of Marketing

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop rock-solid systems for successful product launches. You will own the entire product launch project process, including coordinating deliverables through a project management system, executing on pieces of the launch, coordinating due dates and deliverables, and hitting aggressive launch goals.

  • Collaborate with and coordinate team members, agencies, consultants and freelancers. You’re an expert at getting the best out of people, on time. That means you will collaborate and follow up with copywriters, operations, marketing and other key team members for assignments, timelines, and project and product needs.

  • Coordinate the marketing promotion and campaign process. There are many moving pieces to any given campaign or promotion, from affiliate involvement to social posts and content marketing. This role will ensure that nothing falls between the cracks.

  • Debrief and perform analysis on completed product launches, promotions, and campaigns. There’s always room for improvement. Debriefs allow us to identify weaknesses, areas for improvement, efficiencies and bake excellence into our systems.

  • Ideate and execute promotions, campaigns, and launch experiments. We’re relentlessly curious and committed to trying new marketing channels and running growth experiments. This role will pull the growth experiment process into product launches, promotions and campaigns. Always be testing.

  • Communicate status updates on key deliverables to stakeholders, including VP of Marketing, supply chain team, CEO and COO, etc., ensuring that each milestone is met throughout each project. Our team is small but mighty, and we’re adding to it constantly. This position will be the point person between every stakeholder in a product launch, promotion or campaign. They’ll know the status of deliverables at all times.

  • Ensure consistency in branding across all launch materials, and as applicable with different audiences, proofing all project collateral for accuracy, quality and consistency.

  • Report on and analyze the outcomes of campaigns. We’re a data-oriented, metrics-driven team. Metrics reporting throughout the campaign or launch as well as after the completion of the launch is crucial to our “excellence” ethos.

  • Support ad-hoc marketing projects as required. There are dozens of marketing projects and experiments in our backlog at any given time, just waiting for execution. This role will help us organize these projects and ensure they’re executed on with speed, allowing us to maintain our fast-moving, agile culture.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • 2+ years of experience in a project management, launch coordinator or similar role

  • 2+ years of experience in a growth or marketing role

  • Experience working in a high-growth eCommerce startup environment

  • Demonstrated proficiency with marketing channels such as content, partnerships, social media etc.

  • Proficiency with Excel/Google Sheets, Google Analytics, and other analytics tools

REQUIRED SKILLS AND ABILITIES

  • An excellent communicator. You intuitively know who needs to know what information, and when they need to know it.

  • Organized to a fault. You can’t stand it if your desk is messy. You insist on documenting everything, and you have an aptitude for systemizing every repeatable process in your life.

  • Insanely detail oriented. You never let anything slip through the cracks. Your friends call you “Type A” and you wear that badge proudly.

  • Self starter. You never miss a deadline you're given, but more importantly you thrive on deadlines. Nothing’s more exciting to you than making a plan and following it through to execution.

  • Excellent leadership skills. Project managers and coordinators have to work with an entire team of sometimes conflicting personalities. You know how to get the best out of people, and you know how to do so while still meeting timelines.

  • Results-driven. You know what you’re going after, and you’re driven to achieve it.

  • The ability to travel to Austin quarterly for onsite meetings.

PERKS

We can't take care of others (our customers) without taking care of ourselves (our people) first. That's why we pay extremely competitive salaries and offer a variety of perks to help you optimize your health.

 Salary: We pay top of market because we want the best people at our company.

 Office Hours: You design your own workday. Work whenever you want, from wherever you want.

✈️  Vacation & Holidays: We have a strict two week minimum of vacation taken per year, and anything over that is unlimited and up to you. Take any holiday you want, but also feel free to work on any holiday you want.

 Health insurance: You have the choice to opt-in to the best health insurance we can get. We’re also working towards providing dental and vision coverage.

 Nutrition: You get a monthly budget to invest on getting fresh food locally.

 Fitness: You get a monthly budget to invest on a gym membership, personal trainer, yoga classes, and anything else that helps you increase your physical fitness.

 Books: You get a free Kindle and four books per month.

 Meditation: We cover any app or class you use to improve your meditation consistency.

 Continued Learning: We cover anything that increases your work skills and provide a monthly budget for developing any personal skills you desire. You want to learn Spanish? How to do pottery? We have you covered.

❤️  Free product: You need to be able to brag about how awesome Perfect Keto products are, so team members get free product for their personal use.

️  Retreats: Having fun is one of our core values. Join us on our all expenses paid retreats to fantastic locations.

 Parental Leave: Take the time you need to take care of your baby and yourself. Work will be there when you come back.

We are committed to hiring individuals with a diversity of perspectives, backgrounds, and beliefs who can use their interest in health to help us build an organization that makes a difference in in the world. Join Perfect Keto for the chance to collaborate with a talented and engaged team, passionate about leveraging nutrition to improve people's lives.

Apply for this position

Please apply at https://perfect-keto.workable.com/jobs/825570/candidates/new. We look forward to meeting you!

Citrusbyte

Have you spent the past five years managing software engineers?

In this role, you will manage a team of 10 to 15 engineers operating in small squads of 4-5 engineers and work directly with Product, Research and Design teams as well as customer stakeholders and technical leads to build complex custom software applications.

_Citrusbyte expects employees to be honest, trustworthy, and operate with integrity. Discrimination and all unlawful harassment (including sexual harassment) in employment is not tolerated. We oppose all forms of unlawful or unfair discrimination. Citrusbyte is an equal opportunity employer._



_No statements by Citrusbyte are intended to create an offer of employment unless made in a writing signed by an officer of the company and no offer shall become effective unless countersigned by the prospective employee._

Location: United States

items.title: Citrusbyte: Experienced Engineering Manager
items.content:
Experienced Engineering Manager

Company: Citrusbyte
Headquarters: Los Angeles
https://citrusbyte.com

Have you spent the past five years managing software engineers?

Do you have a proven track record of building teams that deliver complex software on-time and in-budget?

Are you ready to take your career to the next level and work with the best engineers on the planet? 

If so, we want to meet you!

Job Summary
We’re looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to join the team at Citrusbyte.
In this role, you will manage a team of 10 to 15 engineers operating in small squads of 4-5 engineers and work directly with Product, Research and Design teams as well as customer stakeholders and technical leads to build complex custom software applications.

Responsibilities and Duties

As an engineering manager supporting the development of a product, you are responsible for:

Strategy and Consulting
  • Run and / or participate in project kick-offs.
  • Work with your team to choose the tools, architecture, and platforms used to deliver client projects.
  • Define quality standards for client projects.
 Hiring and Training
  • Attract, nurture, coach, and retain talent.
  • Ensure every assigned engineer has a career progression plan with regular check-in points and real-time feedback.
  • Ensure engineers are provided with continuous and valuable learning opportunities.
  • Contribute to determining engineering salary ranges and adjustments.
  • Contribute to defining and building the vision for our engineering organization.
  • Contribute to defining quality standards for our work.
  • Contribute to creating training and learning material and opportunities for engineers.
Managing and Directing
  • Talk to engineers to tease out concerns early, then fix them when possible.
  • Resolve conflicts or performance problems with engineers.
  • Embody the engineering culture and contribute to its advancement, inspiring everyone to live up to it.
  • Maintainer and contributor to our company engineering internal and public artifacts such as our quality standards and guidelines.
  • Represent the engineering organization with other departments and ensure we provide engineering support wherever necessary in the company.
  • Support team happiness.
Engineering and Delivery
  • Responsible for the quality and quantity of the engineering output.
  • Responsible for the continuous, iterative improvement of our engineering team.
  • Responsible for the overall planning, execution, and success of complex technical projects.
  • Work closely with product management team to ensure we're building the best products.
  • When necessary, act as Programmer, QA, Architect, PM, etc for short periods of time.

Benefits and Perks

100% REMOTE

TEAM RETREAT - Once a year the entire Citrusbyte team gets together at an inspiring location to meet, work and play.

HEALTHY BODY, HEALTHY MIND - HAPPY TEAM - We offer paid vacation and support healthy lifestyles through our physical fitness benefits program.

HEALTHCARE & FINANCE - We have comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans, plus we have a 401k plan.

Apply for this position

Apply directly on our careers page: https://citrusbyte.applytojob.com/apply/MkqxdH9RY5/Experienced-Engineering-Manager?source=WWR

(Junior) Business Development Manager // WeVestor Digital

Company: WeVestor Digital

Tags:
  • Business Development
  • strategy
  • FinTech

    • We are searching for you:

    WeVestor Digital AG is a Berlin based fintech company builder. Our vision is to substantially improve the way people invest their money. To reach this goal we are searching for you. Become a part of our vision and change financial investing with us.

    Strategy, product development, user experience, analytics, x-channel marketing. You will support us in the entire lifecycle of building up new products and ventures and can expect to have a direct impact on the direction and growth of our business.

    Your responsibilities:

    As a (Junior) Business Development Manager you will be responsible for developing new and accelerating existing products. You help us to identify the right strategy, design exciting products, shape customer journeys and get the right content and messages to our touchpoints. At the same time you help us improving our sales, marketing and operations processes.

    You are hands-on and strategic at the same time. You are excited about building up something new, working self-organized and are willing to get a deep understanding of our customers and target group. You are fluent in German and have some experience in the financial services industry. You hold a bachelor or master degree in finance, business or engineering? Then we are more than happy hearing from you. However, we are always open to new perspectives, so if you have experience in other industries or fields and believe you would perfectly fit to the position we’re interested in hearing from you too.

    What’s in it for you:

    • Working self-organized in agile teams
    • Space for own ideas and quick decision making
    • Being part of setting up new ventures from day one
    • A very experienced, motivated and tech-driven team with a strong culture and sense for having impact and fun in what they are doing
    • An attractive benefits package, 28 day holiday plan, flexible and remote working opportunities
    • A beautiful office directly on Ku’damm with many interesting and open-minded people around

    About us:

    Founded in 2018, WeVestor Digital AG is a Berlin based fintech company builder. Our mission is building a digital investment bank with the services wealth management, investments in fine art and collectibles and corporate transactions.

    Ready for the next step?

    Ready to design finance with us? Apply now with your CV and/or online portfolio to be considered for the (Junior) Business Development role within the growing WeVestor universe.

    Apply for this position

items.title: Business Development Manager
items.content:
Business Development Manager at 7 Figure Automation

Remote

Reporting to: CEO

Primary Functions: Business Development and account management. This role uses an exciting new method known as “Sales 2.0” – which focuses on research, mutual business fit and consultative discussion. The goal is to generate return on investment for our clients.

Salary: $40,000+/yr

Other: World-class marketing and sales training included for the duration of employment.

Location: Remote

Looking for a job working with a world-class creative agency and to build a career in tech?

Are you looking for a company that will invest in your development and supports your professional growth?

If you answered yes to these questions you may found your dream job!

I’m Mark, the CEO of 7 Figure Automation. I’m looking for a talented individual to join my team as we grow our business and help small businesses simplify their growth.

7 Figure Automation helps Business-to-Business (B2B) companies fill their sales pipeline so they can focus on their clients. We use LinkedIn Marketing, Email Marketing and Telemarketing to help companies increase sales.

Our mission is to become the best performing lead generation company in the world and to help 100 companies double their sales in the next 5 years.

To achieve this we need to build an amazing team. Here’s where you come in.

The Business Development Manager (BDM) will generate new business opportunities for our clients by following a proven process to prospect into companies and schedule meetings. You’ll learn how to help companies develop their target audience, create a bullet-proof marketing strategy, and generate new business opportunities through email and phone campaigns.

The BDM will perform high-level conversations with senior executives about their company, their business issues and their goals.

The individual we’re looking for will be driven, self-motivated, analytical, flexible, honest and should learn quickly. This position has opportunities for advancement within the organization and the remote work lifestyle provides a flexible schedule.

Key Responsibilities

  • Learn and execute prospecting campaigns to generate new sales opportunities
  • Strategize with top-producing sales managers
  • Map prospective accounts around organizational structure, people, and existing technology
  • Engage senior executives in targeted prospect accounts
  • Develop discussions with executives around business issues
  • Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects
  • Leverage CRM tools to prospect into specific geographic territories and sectors
  • Conduct client meetings to review campaign results

Experience Requirements:

  • A strong desire to learn and succeed in tech sales
  • 2+ years sales or related market/business experience
  • Software/SaaS experience, sales experience or other related business experience
  • Writing and phone skills
  • Knowledge of the technology and professional services industry sectors is a plus
  • Salesforce.com experience a plus

Behavioral Requirements:

  • Strong work ethic
  • Curiosity
  • Honesty
  • Commitment follow-through
  • Attention to detail
  • Flexible and adaptive

PLEASE NOTE THAT APPLICANTS MUST RESIDE IN THE US. PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU CANNOT MEET THE LOCATION REQUIREMENTS.

Apply for job

In this role, you will manage a team of 10 to 15 engineers operating in small squads of 4-5 engineers and work directly with Product, Research and Design teams as well as customer stakeholders and technical leads to build complex custom software applications.

Responsibilities and Duties

As an engineering manager supporting the development of a product, you are responsible for:

Strategy and Consulting


* Run and / or participate in project kick-offs.

* Work with your team to choose the tools, architecture, and platforms used to deliver client projects.

* Define quality standards for client projects.




Hiring and Training


* Attract, nurture, coach, and retain talent.

* Ensure every assigned engineer has a career progression plan with regular check-in points and real-time feedback.

* Ensure engineers are provided with continuous and valuable learning opportunities.

* Contribute to determining engineering salary ranges and adjustments.

* Contribute to defining and building the vision for our engineering organization.

* Contribute to defining quality standards for our work.

* Contribute to creating training and learning material and opportunities for engineers.




Managing and Directing


* Talk to engineers to tease out concerns early, then fix them when possible.

* Resolve conflicts or performance problems with engineers.

* Embody the engineering culture and contribute to its advancement, inspiring everyone to live up to it.

* Maintainer and contributor to our company engineering internal and public artifacts such as our quality standards and guidelines.

* Represent the engineering organization with other departments and ensure we provide engineering support wherever necessary in the company.

* Support team happiness.




Engineering and Delivery


* Responsible for the quality and quantity of the engineering output.

* Responsible for the continuous, iterative improvement of our engineering team.

* Responsible for the overall planning, execution, and success of complex technical projects.

* Work closely with product management team to ensure we're building the best products.

* When necessary, act as Programmer, QA, Architect, PM, etc for short periods of time.




Benefits and Perks

100% REMOTE

TEAM RETREAT - Once a year the entire Citrusbyte team gest together at an inspiring location to meet, work and play.

HEALTHY BODY, HEALTHY MIND - HAPPY TEAM - We offer paid vacation and support healthy lifestyles through our physical fitness benefits program.

HEALTHCARE & FINANCE - We have comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans, plus we have a 401k plan.

See more jobs at Citrusbyte

items.content:
Agile Project Manager at CivicActions

Remote

(Multiple states)

Full-Time

Mid Level

CivicActions is a dedicated, fun-loving team, looking for some talented folks to help us bring revolutionary digital services to government agencies and the people they serve.

Description

For this role, you will be project managing two medium-sized projects, managing the budget, deliverables, and process. You’ll do this alongside an amazing scrum team and dedicated clients.

Your good sense of humor, collaborative nature, and high-quality communication style will be a great addition to our talented team. Your presence and work will support our mission to work alongside our government agency clients as partners in open and agile transformation. Together, we’ll make it enjoyable for them to come to work every day, and pass that joy on to their citizens and customers.

We are a mission-minded team, and we’re looking for others with a true passion for using technology to make a positive change in our world. You should be comfortable in a consulting or professional services environment, in addition to working with cross-functional agile teams.

Responsibilities

  • Project planning and concise budgeting
  • Project reporting to track budget, velocity, milestones, and risks
  • Contract management
  • Scope analysis and management via active backlog grooming and road mapping
  • ScrumMastering – conducting ceremonies, ensuring the team is on process and training the client
  • Client management and support
  • Ensure transparency, balance and agility

Skills

  • Agile project management (scrum, kanban)
  • Superior communication
  • Risk analysis
  • Conflict resolution
  • Emotional intelligence (EQ)
  • High-pressure navigation
  • Critical thinking
  • Budget management

Location

We are a fully distributed remote team within the U.S. You can work from home or find a great co-working space. You just need a computer, webcam, strong internet connection and a structured schedule because we are a truly collaborative team.

Benefits

We excel in our benefits offering and believe that people who are well taken care of can be more balanced, healthy and happy. We offer 100% company-paid medical insurance, disability insurance, and life insurance. We have a generous 401(k) program. We have an open vacation policy — employees are encouraged to take time off as needed to feel balanced, productive and healthy. We have paid maternity and paternity leave. We have an annual all-hands retreat to connect with each other in person. We also emphasize professional development and offer an annual stipend.

Community participation is important to us and we ask that you spend 5% of your working time giving back to a community that you care about. We attempt to keep our work products ‘open by default’. This means that it is our intention that your work contributions during your time at CivicActions will be published under public license, enabling you to bring your passion fully into your activities without the fear that your expressions will be locked away or prevented from having a positive impact in the world.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
*What is Zephyr?*

Zephyr specialises in helping businesses grow digitally by helping them to create and execute digital strategies. We use a process that we feel is fundamentally different to any other agency or consultancy out there. We carry out design and strategy work from our London offices but using a team of remote specialists to help execute and iterate upon this work on an ongoing basis using a system that we call the Zephyr Node.

*What do we do for our clients?*
We work with exciting startups to:

Define their brand
Design and develop their digital presence
Create their digital strategy
Manage the execution of this strategy using the Zephyr Node.

*Who do we do it with?*

We work with cutting edge companies such as London’s leading e-bike retailer, one of the first Graphene product companies, a unique, new concept in men’s tailoring, one of the most disruptive social media platforms of recent years as well as many others.

*Why You Should Work for Zephyr?*

We are fun.
We are growing quickly.
You will be part of something completely new.
There is a lot of free beer.

We are a startup ourselves but growing quickly into an exciting innovative company, based in brand new offices in Old Street.

*The Role*
We are looking for someone to help in an account management role managing our retained clients and who is also keen to learn about the project management of branding and web design projects. Core responsibilities will include:

1. Checking how client PPC, SEO, social, growth hacks and other activity is performing against expectations using tools such as ahrefs, Moz, Google Analytics, Webmaster and Adwords.
2. Liaising with clients to scope and manage the execution of changes to their websites.
3. Liaising with our team of specialists to carry out client requests and improve the performance of activity.
4. Provide monthly reports to clients on digital activity, evaluating the work of specialists working on the account and suggesting changes.
5. Working with the strategy team to suggest ways of improving campaign performance and build out new opportunities for our clients.
6. An interest in learning more about web design and development.

*Essential Skills*
Excellent reading, writing and analytical skills.
Highly self motivated and a quick learner
An interest in the digital landscape
Comfortable using Google Adwords, Google Webmaster, Google Analytics & Facebook Adsmanager.
The ability to analyse data generated by these platforms, articulate the results in written reports and come up with actions based on findings.
Comfortable interacting with clients over Slack, Email, Phone and face-to-face.

*Non-essential skills but highly desirable*
Knowledge of Wordpress and CMS platforms
Experience using SEM Rush, Ahrefs or similar SEO tools.
Understanding of Photoshop and other Adobe Suite products such as Illustrator and Premiere Pro.
Knowledge of html,css, js, or PHP.
Experience working with Trello
Experience in Growth Hacking
Knowledge of Social Listening tools such as Iconoclast and audiense
Extensive knowledge of late 60’s Funk and Soul.
Knowledge of Halt and Catch Fire.

*Remuneration*

3 month probationary contract with a view to the position maturing into a full-time salary position. 18k-25k dependent on experience.

items.title: Key Account Manager (w/m/div) – remote möglich // Perseus.
items.content:
Key Account Manager (w/m/div) – remote möglich // Perseus

Company: Perseus

Tags:
  • Account Management
  • Saas
  • remote
  • Customer Relations

    • Perseus ist die erste Service-Plattform, die kleine- und mittelständische Unternehmen umfassend vor Cyber-Risiken schützt. Nutzer des “Perseus-Clubs” erhalten Unterstützung, sowohl bei der Prävention, während eines Notfalls als auch bei der Versicherung von Schadensfällen.

    Perseus wurde Mitte 2017 von erfahrenen Unternehmern und Sicherheitsexperten gegründet und wird von namhaften Investoren aus der Versicherungs- und FinTech-Branche finanziert. Wir sind ein ambitioniertes Team, vereint durch das gemeinsame Ziel die Cyber-Sicherheit für kleine- und mittelständische Unternehmen einfacher und günstiger zu machen.

    Als Key Account Manager (w/m/div) bist Du für das Onboarding neuer Partner sowie der Rundum-Betreuung dieser verantwortlich. Dabei gibst Du unseren strategischen Partnern das Gefühl einer VIP-Betreuung. Du solltest nicht nur gut zuhören, sondern auch komplexe Fakten und Vorgänge einfach und verständlich vermitteln können.

    Da die meisten unserer Partner nicht in Berlin sondern im Süden und Westen Deutschlands ihren Sitz haben, ist es von Vorteil, wenn du selbst schnell vor Ort sein kannst. Daher kannst du gern auch von München, Stuttgart, Düsseldorf, Dortmund oder Frankfurt und Umgebung aus arbeiten.

    Was fordert Dich heraus?

    • Du pflegst enge Beziehungen zu unseren strategischen Partnern (Finanz- und Versicherungsdienstleister) durch einen ausgezeichneten Service, eine schnelle Kundenkommunikation und ein professionelles Problemmanagement
    • Als Single Point of Contact für unsere strategischen Partner bist Du in allen Cyber Security Themen stets auf dem neusten Stand
    • Keiner kennt Perseus so gut wie Du! Daher unterstützt Du bei den Vertriebsschulungen unserer strategischen Partner
    • Arbeite an und mit den aktuellsten Business Modellen, Technologien und Tools in einem zukunftsorientierten Unternehmen mit flachen Hierarchien
    • Profitiere von einem kommunikationsreichen und inspirierenden Arbeitsumfeld in einem sehr erfahrenen, internationalen Team

    Was macht Dich erfolgreich?

    • Du hast bereits Erfahrungen im Customer Relations und After-Sales-Kundensupport sammeln können
    • Weitere Erfahrungen in SaaS White Label Solutions und Indirect Sales sind von großem Vorteil
    • Deine Leidenschaft und Verständnis für die Bedürfnisse unserer Kunden und Partner sind grenzenlos.
    • Du weißt genau, was unser Produkt ausmacht und wie Partner den größten Nutzen daraus ziehen können
    • Als Erstkontakt für unsere Strategischen Partner findest du immer die richtigen Worte und agierst dabei stets mit Freundlichkeit und Empathie
    • Neben Deinen sehr guten Kommunikations- und Analysefähigkeiten, zeichnest Du Dich durch Projektmanagementfähigkeiten sowie die Fähigkeit des aktiven Zuhörens aus
    • Deine Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sind auf höchstem Niveau

     Warum Perseus?

    • In unserem Team pflegen wir eine Kultur des Zuhörens. Wir schätzen und respektieren unterschiedliche Meinungen und Feedback
    • Unsere Herangehensweise an Projekte ist agil und ganzheitlich
    • Eine ruhige und störungsfreie Arbeitsatmosphäre ist uns wichtig – um unsere Fähigkeiten weiter zu verbessern und Produkte zu erschaffen, auf die wir alle stolz sein können
    • Zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung bieten wir Extras wie Lern- und Tagungsbudgets, Bücher und Online-Kurse
    • Wir arbeiten zentral gelegen am Zoologischen Garten mit viel Raum zum Wachsen und Gestalten
    Apply for this position

items.content:
Project Manager

PM
Various US States & Canada
Company: The Wirecutter
Full Time

Overview

The Wirecutter is seeking an organized, action oriented, hands-on project manager to lead strategic projects for our Product Platform team.  You will be responsible for projects of varying complexity that connect our readers to the best products. As opportunities arise, you may also work across another product development team to manage their projects to success.

As a project manager at Wirecutter, you are a core member of 1-2 cross-functional project teams. You are expected to identify opportunities, suggest solutions, and act decisively when necessary to advance a project. This is a new position that reports to the Senior Project Manager and will work closely with Product, Engineering and Design.

To succeed in this role, you will have:

  • The experience and wisdom to lead project teams and manage risks. You have shipped products on time, on budget, and within scope.
  • The ability to take ownership of complex efforts and mediate between competing interests and personalities to get alignment and motivate change. You are proactive in identifying and resolving problems before they occur.
  • Excellent organizational skills. You are able to conscientiously manage and follow up on multiple concurrent tasks and requests on tight deadlines.
  • Superb communication skills, including the ability to communicate between technical and non-technical contributors in a contextually intelligent manner.
  • Effective critical thinking skills to tease out the risks in plans, eliminate blockers, and ensure on time project delivery.
  • The ability to communicate with engineers on technical topics including how REST APIs function, the lifecycle events of a CRUD app, and web development in PHP.

    • Responsibilities

    • Act as a strong leader and owner of software development projects; motivate and maintain momentum as you drive those projects to successful, smooth, on-time completion
    • Champion and support agile software development practices, and tailor that process (including standups, planning, review and retrospective sessions, demos and more) to each project team
    • Actively seek out, track and remove barriers to completing a project. Look beyond the obvious for continuous opportunities for improvement
    • Work closely with Engineering, Design, Product, and stakeholders to build consensus and handle dependencies
    • Support management decisions with relevant data around capacity, scope, and impact
    • Manage and maintain project information, including feature definition and scope, and epic and sprint planning
    • Maintain the engineering roadmap for your team and communicate roadmap changes to appropriate parties
    • Assist in creating and updating documentation around team process, workflow and culture
    • Develop and roll out new or enhanced practices or processes to increase team efficiency and effectiveness
    • Proactively manage projects that span across multiple engineering teams, ensuring alignment with internal and external partners.

      • Qualifications

      • 3+ years Project Management experience (formal or informal) including agile practices
      • Certified Scrum Master or equivalent experience on a scrum team
      • Knowledge of Jira, Confluence, Excel or other equivalent Project Management Software Tools
      • Exemplary interpersonal skills and self awareness
      • Experience working on software development projects; an understanding of web technologies and an ability to learn technical concepts quickly
      • Ability to manage and multi-task across multiple projects
      • Experience working in a remote or hybrid organization preferred
      • Ability to take initiative and work independently
      • Enthusiasm for Wirecutter’s mission and our innovation and growth

        • About Wirecutter

        Founded five years ago by journalists fed up with the time and energy it takes to shop, Wirecutter developed a simpler approach to giving buying advice: Just tell people exactly what to get in one single guide. The company’s purpose: to help people find great things, quickly and easily. Through rigorous testing, research, reporting, and whatever means necessary, we create straightforward recommendations that save readers unnecessary stress, time, and effort.  We then monetize these guides by enabling our readers to easily purchase the products they are interested in.

        Wirecutter was recently acquired by, and is now a subsidiary of, The New York Times Company.  As part of the acquisition, The Times is investing in Wirecutter to accelerate its business through editorial category expansion, development of more robust product features, and unlocking of new revenue streams.

        Locations

        Even with offices in New York City and Los Angeles, Wirecutter remains a highly remote culture, and open to employing people across the country (and in Canada!).  Right now, we are eligible to hire in CA, CO, CT, DC, FL, GA, HI, IL, MA, ME, MI, MN, MO, NC, NH, NV, NY, OR, PA, TX, VA, or WA. If you live outside of these states but are still interested in working with Wirecutter, you are welcome to apply, and we will keep your information on file for future opportunities.

        Benefits and Perks:

        • Make an impact by supporting our original, independent and deeply reported journalism.
        • We provide competitive health, dental, vision and life insurance for employees and their families
        • We support responsible retirement planning with a generous 401(k) company match.
        • We offer a competitive parental leave.
        • We are committed to career development and ongoing learning, and provide employees $8,000 annually for tuition reimbursement.
        • We have frequent panel discussions and talks by a wide variety of newsmakers and industry leaders.
        • Join a community committed to the richness of diversity, experiences and talents in the world we cover, supported by a variety of employee resource groups.

          • The New York Times is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce, one that reflects the varied global community we serve. Our journalism and the products we build in the service of that journalism greatly benefit from a range of perspectives, which can only come from diversity of all types, across our ranks, at all levels of the organization. Achieving true diversity and inclusion is the right thing to do. It is also the smart thing for our business. So we strongly encourage women, veterans, people with disabilities, people of color and gender nonconforming candidates to apply.

          The New York Times Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s sex, age, race, color, creed, national origin, alienage, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation or affectional preference, gender identity and expression, disability, genetic trait or predisposition, carrier status, citizenship, veteran or military status and other personal characteristics protected by law. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected characteristics.



          To apply for this job please visit the URL below.

          Please reference Jobspresso in your job application, so that remote companies know where their best candidates are coming from

          https://nytimes.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Wirecutter/job/New-York-NY/Project-Manager_REQ-003591-1 →

items.title: Director of Engineering
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG:surround``OR(pacif, pst, pdt, western, california, losangel, sanfrancisco, paloalto, sanmateo) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
The universe of openly licensed content is massive and growing, and we want to light it up — make it more discoverable, usable, and connected. This is the opportunity: to build products and services — both standalone and within our partner platforms — that will bring the commons to life with greater use, re-use, and contribution. Our primary product is CC Search.

 

There is no “front door” to the commons, and with over 1.4 billion works on over 9 million websites, the tools people need to curate, share, and remix works aren’t yet available. We launched CC Search in 2017, indexing about 1 percent of the commons, and a focus on images as a first media type. Today, CC’s dev capacity includes a four person tech team, who collaborate with our Director of Product and Research. The product is supported by multiple multi-year grants.

 

This project will unite hundreds of millions of records for works and metadata, multiple platforms, diverse media types, and a variety of user communities and partners. It’s a difficult but rewarding problem for an inspired and creative leader. We want to build this product as part of an open community, and create something useful, delightful, and essential to the work of creators, educators, scientists, cultural institutions, and our partners.

 

Primary Responsibilities

The Director of Engineering is part of the Tools and Product team, and reports to the CEO. You will lead the technical design, development and implementation of CC’s products and services. This is a rare opportunity to lead within an organization that is fundamental to sharing online, operating at a global scale. The successful candidate will lead a technical team to meet the needs of this vital organization, and to build a more vibrant, usable global commons, powered by collaboration and gratitude.

 

We believe that diverse teams build better organizations and better services. Applications from qualified candidates from all backgrounds, including those from under-represented communities, are encouraged and very welcome.  

 

The Director of Engineering leads the technology team to:

  • Develop, lead and implement an ambitious technical development strategy that is informed by, and aligned with, CC’s product strategy to bring CC Search and other relevant services to lift
  • Manage and motivate our team of developers and designers to build innovative, robust software both for CC use and for public release
  • Work in the open and ship often, in public repositories, open chat rooms, public wikis and a global community
  • Work with the CEO, Director of Product and Research, and Director of Development (Fundraising) to seek funding for CC’s various technical projects
  • Represent the organization and provide technical leadership within various open communities and with CC partners. Coordinate with other outside communities, companies, and institutions to further Creative Commons’ mission, for example: W3C, non-profit communities like EFF, Open Knowledge, and Wikipedians, and the open data, open access, library, and open education communities

Qualifications and requirements

  • Proven team and engineering leadership, and an entrepreneurial spirit: a collaborative, motivated self-starter
  • Demonstrated experience building and deploying large scale web services; experience on mobile is a plus; you’ve led teams before and know how to keep your eye on the big picture, while shipping incrementally and frequently
  • Ability to identify and scope user requirements and develop specifications
  • Excellent management, written, and oral communication skills
  • Familiarity with content licensing including Free/Open licenses a plus
  • Familiarity with consumer privacy
  • Fluent in one of Spanish, Arabic, or French (in addition to English) a plus
  • Desire to work in a diverse, global, highly collaborative team environment

 

Diversity

We believe that diverse teams build better organizations and better services. Applications from qualified candidates from all backgrounds, including those from under-represented communities, are very welcome. Creative Commons works as part of a global community, guided by collaboratively developed codes of conduct and anti-harassment policies.

Work Environment and Location

Creative Commons is a distributed organization. This position is available to applicants working in the range of the Eastern to Pacific time zones, in a remote working environment. You must have reasonable mobility for necessary travel, including twice-annual all-staff meetings and the Global Summit, and high-speed broadband access. Laptop/desktop computer and necessary resources are supplied.

 

Salary and Benefits

Creative Commons is a leading non-profit employer, offering competitive salaries and benefits, including health and wellness plans, annual retirement contributions, and a positive, supportive work environment. The salary range for this position is $110,000 to $140,000 USD, commensurate with relevant skills and experience.
