items.content:
Technical Project Manager at Four Kitchens

Remote
  • (Multiple states)
  • Full Time
  • Project Management
  • Mid Level

Are you a CMS-savvy project manager who is a great listener and thrives on driving complex projects to success? Do you love to collaborate and facilitate communication between technical and business people? Are you excited by data-driven and detail-oriented planning? We want you to join our team of talented strategists, project managers, and project owners!

The Technical Project Manager role is ideal for a self-starter and who takes their responsibility for a project’s holistic success very seriously. A Technical PM is part digital strategist, part project owner, part account manager, and part project manager. Yes, that is a lot of parts!

Responsibilities

  • Plan and monitor web projects for clients, resulting in on-time and on-budget delivery.
  • Understand and manage the staffing needed to complete a complex, multi-phase project effectively.
  • Lead project meetings based in the Agile/Scrum methodology.
  • Meet regularly with clients to discuss their needs and project status, address how out of scope requests will be addressed, and to remove project impediments.
  • Coordinate and facilitate the most effective set of touchpoints between client and development team to ensure efficiency, increase clarity, and resolve issues.
  • Navigate tricky conversations with clients regarding potential budget and/or timeline compromises.
  • Know enough about development tasks to help with prioritization and functional discussions.
  • Some travel for onsite project kick-offs with clients.

Qualifications

Essential

  • At least two years of project management experience working with large website projects.
  • Proficiency in JIRA.
  • Experience using the Agile/Scrum project management methodology.
  • Experience in a client services environment supporting multiple clients and projects across different industries.
  • Demonstrated initiative, follow-through, attention to detail, proactivity, and a proven history of delivering high-quality work.
  • Comfort with being the direct client contact, negotiating with stakeholders, and building rapport.
  • Desire to continually learn new technologies and processes and apply them where appropriate.
  • Intellectual curiosity and passion for making really cool stuff for the web.

Bonus

  • Prior experience designing, theming, or developing for Drupal.
  • Prior experience as a project manager developing Drupal or WordPress websites.
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher. (Why preferred rather than required? Experience and passion are more important, and being a constant self-educator is essential.)

Benefits

  • Generous time off policy. We plan for each team member to take up to 25 days of time off annually. Take time when you need it and own your destiny!
  • Paid holidays including days such as MLK Day, 4K Founding Day, and a Winter Holiday (usually a full week).
  • $2,000 annual professional development and education budget. This can be spent on conferences, seminars, classes anything that advances your professional goals.
  • 100% paid medical insurance for employee, including dental and vision.
  • 100% paid life and disability insurance for employee.
  • 3% Safe Harbor non-elective employer 401k contribution.
  • $150/month tech stipend to spend on your home office and equipment needs.
  • Flexible scheduling and working remotely.
  • An excellent work environment filled with smart, funny people who love what they do.

About Four Kitchens

Four Kitchens is a leading digital strategy firm with strong roots in the open-source and free-culture communities. We build websites and apps to engage audiences on virtually any device, in our pursuit of setting knowledge free. We hire developers, designers, and strategists with strong consultative skills and a desire to make a difference, both to our clients and to each other.

Our Values and Culture

Our Web Chefs bring more than their professional skills to the kitchen and we encourage everyone to help guide the direction of our company. We all have a strong voice in what we do and how we do it. Collectively, our valuesThe Way Of the Web Chefguide how we interact with each other, our colleagues, and our clients. Four Kitchens is not just a company it’s a closely knit team. We believe in the power of individuals coming together to do something bigger than they could have done alone.

Distributed Work

We believe good talent is where you find it and, as a distributed team, we’re excited to be pioneers in what we believe is the future of work-culture. Even though we have no physical office, we strive to remain a collaborative community using tools like Slack and Zoom. The Web Chefs span four time zones and our goal is for team members to feel like they are working together in the same room, even if they’re thousands of miles apart.

Our Benefits

We care for our teammates as people, which is why we have a generous PTO policy, encourage time off, and have a great benefits package. Not only do we strive to maintain a good work-life balance, but we also participate in interesting and creative projects outside of client work to expand our abilities.

We hope you’ll join us!

Apply for job

Regional Director at Advancing Women Executives

San Francisco, San Francisco Bay Area, Silicon Valley, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$90K–$100K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

What does it feel like working for a company where clients every day say to you, "Thank you for doing what you do!"?
What does it feel like working for a company where you're impacting positive change in the world?
What does it feel like working for a company where you are constantly learning?
What does it feel like working for a company where you're stimulated intellectually by your peers while, at the same time, laughing and not taking yourself too seriously?
It feels great and this is what working at AWE feels like every day.

Advancing Women Executives (AWE) is a start-up with the mission to accelerate the careers of women in business to improve the global economy, by providing VP-level and above corporate executive women the opportunity to build cross-functional and cross-industry relationships in a safe, locally-based environment. AWE membership services include events, training, and executive coaching. AWE currently has memberships in San Francisco, Los Angeles, Silicon Valley, New York and Chicago. AWE is based in Los Angeles, CA, but has staff in all other membership cities.

AWE is seeking a highly qualified Regional Director to join our team to be based in the Bay Area and report to the Founder and CEO. The primary responsibility of this role is to sell AWE services to VP-level and above corporate executive women for the purposes of furthering AWE’s mission and generating business revenue.

Responsibilities:
Prospecting and closing new AWE memberships in San Francisco, Silicon Valley, and Los Angeles;
Network and build relationships with the top influencers in corporate America, private equity, venture capital and service industries;
Lead and develop a team of sales and client relations associates;
Executing a sales methodology with an average sales cycle of 6 weeks or less;
Partner with Associate Director of Member Relations to ensure AWE leaders are active and engaged in membership through a consultative sales approach;
Sales forecasting and new business pipeline management;
Strategize about sales and client relations process and services;
Conduct Training Sessions across California locations;
Host bi-annual events and monthly dinners with AWE leaders.

Qualifications
A successful candidate will possess:

True belief in AWE’s mission to significantly improve the number of women in senior management and on board seats;
The spirit to “Be Bold” and fearless in representing AWE, even during its start-up phase;
Spirit of generosity and service;
Intellectual curiosity and drive to problem solve;
Natural ability to connect with people and to be a connector for people;
6+ years transactional sales experience with success negotiating and closing business;
Exceptional ability to immediately establish one's credibility with senior executives;
Willingness to work outside strict job description parameters, thinking creatively about how to provide the highest level of customer/member service and overall business growth;
Excellent written and oral communication skills;
Strong public speaking skills and experience presenting to large groups;
Great sense of humor;
Excellent meeting facilitation skills; ability to conduct 100% phone-based meetings;
Solid understanding of business concepts and ability to quickly learn content terrain;
Ability to diagnose prospect needs and identify relevant resources;
Ability to meet personal and team weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual financial goals;
Solid understanding of business concepts & dynamics for large national and international corporations;
Superior time management, detail orientation and organization skills;
Bachelor's Degree required, MBA preferred.

AWE is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Director of Engineering

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Information Technology, IT Security, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Auth0 | Bellevue, WA

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-08:00) Pacific Time +/- 4 hours
Office Location: Bellevue, WA. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

reactjs
cloud
node.js

Job description

Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Our extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 1.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and is continuing its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!

Due to explosive growth Auth0 is seeking a Director of Engineering to help lead and scale our software development and innovation efforts to deliver the most advanced authentication and authorization SaaS on the market. This is a full time technical leadership role overseeing the growth of our highly productive teams of smart and engaged engineers. Successful candidates will be located on the west coast in PST (UTC−8 or within 3 hours) OR London metro area (UTC+1).

Auth0 has been remote-first since inception and fully embraces a remote workstyle. VP’s and C level execs work remote and we have the tools and resources in-place to ensure success. Not only are we looking for a talented Engineering leader, we are looking for someone who will contribute to our culture.

You will:

  • Work closely with our Team Leads, Engineering Directors and VP of Engineering to help scale our Engineering Organization to meet our customer and product needs.
  • Lead, mentor and coach a mix of new and seasoned engineering managers running widely distributed teams.
  • Work closely with Product & Design to build the next generation of Identity products.
  • Provide operational excellence and implement processes and policies that create efficiencies during a time of massive growth.
  • Maintain our high security, performance and availability SLA’s as we rapidly scale for customers with 100M+ monthly active users.
  • Lead teams that continuously ship product improvements, measures the results, and iterateHelp convert our systems to be service based and cloud agnostic.
  • Define and execute engineering and company wide OKR’s.

About you:

  • You have experienced high-growth in a short period of time and are comfortable with putting systems in place and adjusting and adapting when needed.
  • You are comfortable leading and managing widely distributed teams (Geography and Time).  This is core to our culture and even our VP of Engineering is remote.
  • You care about culture and values and like to be a steward for values such as transparency, collaboration, inclusiveness, accountability and experimentation.
  • You have experience managing, coaching and growing other engineering managers and team leads. We have a strong culture of promoting from within so we are looking for someone who is comfortable grooming first-time managers.
  • You set clear goals and clear expectations for your team. Your goal is to to empower your teams to make decisions and your managers to one day do your job.  
  • You work closely with your peer organizations to ensure cross-team collaboration is effective.
  • You have outstanding communication and presentation skills including the ability to effectively interface with business, executive, and technical teams.
  • You have built and scaled distributed systems on public clouds (Amazon, Azure, GCP, etc.).
  • You are open about technology choices, and like to contribute to OSS projects. Our current stack focuses on Node, ElasticSearch, MongoDB, and React but we focus on picking the right tools for the job.
  • You have experience allocating and deploying resources across teams and managing to a budget.
  • You are located in PST (UTC−8 or within 3 hours) OR London, UK metro area (UTC+1).
  • You ideally have experience in the identity and access management (IAM) domain (not required).

Auth0 fosters an inclusive workplace free from discrimination. Auth0 is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Auth0 conducts all employment-related activities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, genetics, or status as a Vietnam-era special disabled and other covered veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Auth0 participates in E-Verify and will confirm work authorization for candidates residing in the United States.

Apply now

About Auth0

Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Its extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 1.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and continues its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!

Benefits

  • Flexible Work Arrangements
  • Competitive Equity
  • Top-of-the-Line Macbooks and other great tools
  • Embrace Distributed Work
  • Inclusive Work Environment
  • Annual all-expenses paid international company offsite

Senior Developer with functional programming expertise (preferably Clojure)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Academic Research, Machine Learning, Publishing
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Knowledge E | Dubai, United Arab Emirates

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+03:00) Riyadh +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Dubai, United Arab Emirates. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Visa Sponsorship: Yes
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

functional-programming
clojure
machine-learning
bigdata
datomic

Job description

The Role

You’ll be a key driver for the development of our discovery service and be working alongside a small multi-disciplinary team including service design, backend and frontend developers and our QA team. The discovery service will eventually include 100+ million full-text articles that need to be indexed automatically to enable the end users an outstanding user experience for accessing research literature, including intelligent searches, advanced browsing through subject categories and get highly relevant recommendations on what to read and whom to collaborate with, based on their search and navigation behaviour on the platform.

To deliver excellent solutions, you should be able to think out of the box and pro-actively elaborate new creative solutions to the challenges researchers and students are facing. It is also important that you stay up-to-date with latest trends and technologies in related areas, like NLP, AI, Machine Learning and Big Data as well as within the research and publishing domain. 

You Are

Passionate about working with big data and making sense out of it for the end users by applying artificial intelligence and machine learning tools and techniques. 

Minimum Job Qualifications

  • Excellent programming skills to ensure elegant solutions with high performance, ideally with proficiency in at least one functional programming language such as Clojure (preferable).
  • Ability to work with handling large volumes of data, including parsing, ingestion and indexing 
  • Fluent in English

Desired Extras

  • University degree, for example in Computer Science
  • Experience with Datomic, Elastic search, Google's Knowledge Graph, NLP, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, ...
Apply now

About Knowledge E

At Knowledge E we’re a passionate team of 25+ hands-on entrepreneurs, engineers and research domain experts that want to make the lives of researchers a great deal easier and a bit more fun, and make as significant behind-the-scene-contributions as possible to advancing the research front to the benefit for all of us. We’re well funded through our existing content subscription-based business and grow steadily through new, dynamic research institutions turning to us for our more recent capacity-building training, publishing and discovery services.

The development team currently includes 8 members having roles ranging from Service Design & UX to System Architecture, Frontend & Backend development, Testing & Quality Assurance and Technical Support.

Benefits

  • International, agile and fun team to work with!
  • Flexible a generous vacation possibilities
  • 1 week free for charity work sponsored by Knowledge E Foundation
  • Regular team events & joint after-work activities
  • Select your own awesome hardware
  • Worrying free compensation package
  • Remote work possible

items.content:
Head of Engineering

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Manager
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Customer Data Platform, Data & Analytics, Mobile Analytics
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Snowplow Analytics Ltd | London, UK

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+00:00) London +/- 4 hours
Office Location: London, UK. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

cloud
data
scala
scalability
microservices

Job description

Head of Engineering

Ideally located in London, Berlin or Amsterdam (open to other locations)

At Snowplow, we are on a mission to empower people to differentiate with data. We provide both the technology and services to enable our customers to not only take control of their data, but allow them to do amazing things with that control.

As part of that effort, we're changing the way that people do digital analytics by moving companies away from a one-size-fits-all mindset and enabling them to collect and own their data themselves.

The Opportunity

Following rapid company growth over the last 12 months, we’re now looking for a Head of Engineering to join us and lead, guide & support our fully-remote engineering team through the next phases of growth. Though the team is still relatively small, they’re already dealing with hugely complex challenges spanning across product, data engineering, cloud architecture, automation and much more.

The role will comprise of 3 key parts:

  • People Management

We have a talented & diverse team of engineers - it will be your job to coach & mentor them, to ensure their personal development is being looked after and to continue to hire people that are not only strong technically, but also closely align with our company culture (wherever they may be located).  

  • Growth

Snowplow’s growth plans are ambitious and a large part of the role will be focused around scaling the technology and coming up with creative ways to overcome obstacles. Our Head of Engineering should be at the forefront of technical innovation, able to prioritise with ease and confident making difficult decisions. We’re looking for someone forward-thinking, who is able to deliver great results now, while also looking ahead at the next hurdle.

  • Technical Excellence

We want to build the possible product and in order to do so, we require technical expertise. We expect our Head of Engineering to do things right and to instil this in the entire team. Best practices, consistent performance and outstanding delivery.

The role is unique, the challenges are complex and the team is diverse. We’re looking for someone who takes all of this and is excited about solving those challenges, and continuing to build a high-performing engineering team at Snowplow.

Things you’ll be doing:

  • Own and operate the Agile processes that we are running
  • Conduct regular 1:1s, champion personal development and hire awesome talent
  • Focus on automation and scaling our current technology
  • Hold the team to high standards and deliver outstanding results
  • Work closely with Product & Engineering to shape how our product is being developed, delivered & refined
  • Improve efficiency & stability
  • Lead with authority, positivity and by example

We’d love to hear from you if:

  • You have experience of working in an engineering management or leadership position looking after multiple squads
  • You have worked with remote teams and are comfortable heading up a geographically distributed team
  • You have a background in one or more of the following:
    • Building SaaS & Web Apps
    • Data Engineering
    • Microservices or Cloud Architecture
  • You exude technical leadership & authoritativeness while also fostering an environment of openness & respect
  • The idea of growing an engineering team in a fast-paced startup excites you
  • You have experience scaling technology
  • You inspire and motivate those around you
  • You’re confident making difficult decisions and navigating change

What you’ll get in return:

  • A competitive package, including share options
  • 25 days of holiday a year (plus bank holidays)
  • Freedom to work wherever suits you best
  • Two fantastic company Away-Weeks in a different European city each year (the last one was in Milan in May 2018)
  • Work alongside a supportive and talented team
  • Grow and develop in a fast-moving, collaborative organisation
  • MacBook Pro
  • Enjoy fun events in and around London organised by our Cultural Work Committee
  • Improve your existing skills or mentor more junior developers in our Software Development Guild
  • Convenient location in central London (Shoreditch)
  • Continuous supply of Pact coffee
Apply now

Benefits

  • A competitive package, including share options
  • MacBook Pro
  • 25 days holiday plus bank holidays
  • Freedom to work wherever suits you best
  • Flexible working hours
  • Two fantastic company Away Weeks a year (last one was in Milan)
  • Convenient Shoreditch office location
  • Regular fun events organised by our Cultural Works Committee
  • Improve coding skills with our Software Development Guild
  • Regular meetups/team offsites

items.content:
Technical Project Manager – Scrum Master (Austin, TX)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Real Estate
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Jovio | Austin, TX

Remote details

Office Location: Austin, TX. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

agile
project-management
scrum
jira

Job description

We’re looking for an experienced Technical Project Manager – Scrum Master to oversee multiple products from initial requirements gathering through acceptance testing while facilitating adherence to an agile methodology. Specifically, the Technical Project Manager – Scrum Master will:

  • Coordinate and facilitate daily stand-ups, project planning and estimation, retrospectives, backlog grooming, release planning, stakeholder demos and other Scrum-related ceremonies. 
  • Implement and foster a lean environment where agile principles create a predictable, priority-driven culture which continuously delivers more value to customers in shorter iterations. 
  • Actively manage issues and sprints to ensure reliable delivery of sprint goals and deliverables across multiple projects and teams. 
  • Maintain desired sprint velocity and hold participants accountable for their responsibilities to ensure timely delivery of software releases. 
  • Monitor and report project KPI's including code quality, velocity, productivity, etc.
  • Own and swiftly break down impediments that prevent things from moving forward. 
  • Assist Product Owner as needed with backlog maintenance, internal and external communication, improving transparency, and disseminating information.

Qualifications:

  • 2+ years experience in a Technical Project Manager – Scrum Master role within a SaaS or enterprise software company practicing agile software development
  • Fluency in Atlassian Suite 
  • Experience managing team members in remote locations
  • Intuition to know when to challenge teams and when to get out of the way
  • Ardent desire to continually improve the agile process 
  • Thrive in a fast-paced, growing company, where scrappy solutions and rapid experiments mobilize innovation 
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills to create, and maintain, focus on key outcomes
  • “Can do” attitude, team player, fun, energetic personality, works well under pressure
  • Genuine passion to improve the real estate industry
Apply now

About Jovio

Jovio is a new kind of real estate brokerage taking a transcendent approach to homeownership and real estate transactions. From streamlined brokerage services to empowering products and tools, Jovio is architecting tomorrow’s real estate marketplace.

Benefits

  • Small Team - Big Impact
  • Modern Tech Stack
  • Remote Ok
  • Flexible Hours

items.content:
Lead Software Developer / Technical Project Manager

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Business Intelligence, Data & Analytics, Developer APIs
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: MapLarge | No office location

Technologies

c#
api
typescript
amazon-web-services
geolocation

Job description

100% Remote: This role allows working remotely 100% of the time from anywhere in the US.  Workers must be authorized to work in the US (No Non US Applicants Please). 

Who We Need: We are looking for talented software developers to act as lead developers in a customer facing, technical project manager role.  Applicants should have a strong history as a lead software developer (no non-technical project managers, please) and should be a top notch C# and JavaScript programmer.  We are looking for sophisticated team members who are passionate about not only how UI is used, but also how the APIs, ontology, data structures, documentation, and examples come together to make both the UI components and technical APIs a pleasure for customers to use.

Typical Tasks: Typical Tasks include both writing code and leading planning activities.  You will often be acting as the lead technical point of contact on customer engagements, running internal and external planning meetings, helping to wireframe user interfaces, creating specs for the public facing APIs that drive them, doing deep dive code reviews with developers, and writing code for key portions of the deployed application.

Skills: While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, these are the key traits we prefer for this role:

  1. Smart & High Energy Engineer - We work at a very fast pace on cutting edge hard problems and we need people who can keep up.   We need people who really love producing results for customers and who enjoy programming and exhibit the energy and creativity that comes from being fully engaged in the technical side of what we do.
  2. Strong Software Development background - This job is definitely NOT for non technical project managers. Recent, hands-on experience coding both server side (C#) and client side (JavaScript) are strongly suggested, and 5+ years work experience as a professional programmer is required.  
  3. Experience Wireframing UI & Designing APIs - You do not have to have strong artistic skills, but you should be comfortable not only spec-ing out UI wireframes but also designing the supporting technical web service API’s and/or client side component API’s.
  4. Technical Project Management:  You should be highly organized with a strong history in either technical project management or as the lead developer for complex software development projects.  
  5. Customer Facing: comfortable meeting with sophisticated customers and managing expectations on large high value projects.
Apply now

About MapLarge

MapLarge provides Big Data Analytics and Visualization to make the world safer, more productive, and more efficient.  The MapLarge API provides real time geospatial and predictive analytics for over 15 billion location events per day and trillions of historical events. Analysts using our geospatial visualization capability can instantly query and visualize data on any desktop, mobile or tablet device.  All of our UI components are re-usable, data driven, event driven, API powered (client and server side), scriptable, re-configurable, savable, deep linkable, shareable etc.  We also have editor components, and data visualization wizards that allow non-technical users to import, automatically visualize data patterns (with sensible defaults that “just work”), conduct predictive analysis and also re-configure more advanced detailed settings with “what you see is what you get” editor tools.

Benefits

  • Flexible Hours
  • No Commute (work from home 100%)
  • Technically Excellent A+ Team solving very hard interesting problems
  • Friendly People - Postitive attitude is our #1 criteria
  • 401k
  • We like all kinds of people
  • Family Friendly
  • Top Notch Health Care
  • Cutting Edge Tech

items.content:
Cotiviti Labs Functional Programming Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Healthcare, Retail Analytics
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Public
Company: Cotiviti | Atlanta, GA

Remote details

Office Location: Atlanta, GA. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

scala
java
functional-programming
hadoop
hazelcast

Job description

Developers with the Cotiviti Labs team are responsible for working with a global team of medical doctors and business experts to create break-through solutions for incredibly difficult problems. We use a combination of innovative and proven technologies game-changing solutions. In 2017, we found $3.2B in savings for our clients in 2017 to spend on better health care for their members. 

We use a combination of innovative and proven technologies to put game-changing solutions into production as quickly as possible. Our solutions are scalable, elastic, concurrent, parallel, and deliver results to our clients in real-time.  We are a functional programming shop but are willing to use the best technologies to get into production quickly.  Our DevOps team members have created a sophisticated ChatOps infrastructure that supports everything from deployments, to releases, to provisioning new clients. Our continuous integration and build facilities are world class.

Take our online coding test to get the process started!

REQUIREMENTS:

  • A burning desire to see your work in production
  • A passion for and experience with functional programming languages (Scala, Haskell, Erlang, Clojure, Java 8)
    • Experience with Scalaz/Cats is a plus
    • Purescript/Elm/Ghcjs is a plus
  • A passion for and experience with concurrent and parallel development
  • A deep understanding of Reactive Architectures
  • Desire and passion to learn new concepts and software
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving ability
  • Strong mathematical skills
  • Professional with ability to properly handle confidential information
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment
  • We are a diverse, multi-cultural global team so you must have excellent written and verbal English skills. Fluency in Hindi, Russian, or Telegu is a plus.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 3+ years’ experience in advanced development environments delivering production solutions
  • Degree in computer science (Masters degree is a plus)
  • 95% or higher on our online Scala coding test.
  • Creativity and critical thinking
  • Ability to work independently as well as collaborate as a team

JOB DEMANDS:

  • Must be able to sit and use a computer keyboard for extended periods of time
  • After hours/weekend work required where necessary for major deliverables/deadlines (not consistent)
  • Must have flexibility and willingness to participate in the work processes of an international organization, including conference calls scheduled to accommodate global time zones.
  • Mastery of Cards Against Humanity

KEY CONSTITUENTS:

  • VP of Innovation
  • Chief Operations Officer
  • Chief Digital Officer
Apply now

About Cotiviti

The Cotiviti Labs team is the advanced research and development arm of Cotiviti Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: COTV), a leading provider of analytics-driven payment accuracy solutions primarily focused on the healthcare industry. We work with data from billions of health care interactions that occur every day between doctors and patients and convert that data into a rich web of relationships that we then mine for patterns. Each pattern is translated into a solution that helps our clients achieve a superior level of payment accuracy. Joining our team will provide you with a rewarding opportunity to influence healthcare efficiency and effectiveness by discovering and deploying new Cotiviti solutions.

The Cotiviti Labs team has a flat organizational structure so people on this team have no direct managers, are responsible for their own work assignments, and will receive and give quarterly 360 reviews from their peers. We have no deadlines, only a requirement to move as fast as humanly possible and make every minute count. To thrive in this environment team member must have a passion for computer science, technology, innovation, and delivery.

We value teamwork above everything. We succeed together as a team and are accountable to each other for that success. Though we are scattered across the world we regularly get together to have fun. If you are looking for such a tribe apply now.

Learn more about our team by reading our handbook!

Benefits

  • Close to the Marta!
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Remote work available
  • Have a big impact on healthcare
  • Work with an amazing team
  • Use powerful technologies
  • Tuition Reimbersement
  • Flexible work schedule

items.title: Executive Assistant
items.content:
Executive Assistant at SAP

Remote

Additional Locations: Virtual – USA

Requisition ID: 193807
Work Area: Finance
Expected Travel: 0 – 10%
Career Status:Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

In this role you will be supporting the Global Vice President of Credit Services for NA and their supporting managers.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS
In this role as a Executive Assistant, your main responsibility will be to support the with the following tasks:

 

    • Provide liaison between the Global Vice President of Credit Services and their management team, key executives, employees and external business partners by being proactive and able to identify and solve problems and acting as Single Point of Contact for assigned responsibilities
    • Provide confidential administrative support
    • Support in daily operations regarding time management, prioritization etc.
    • Manage calendar (maintain/prioritize and organize meetings)
    • Manage inbox (track emails / respond post discussion with the manager)
    • Follow up and track all open items and action on them appropriately
    • Coordinate travel arrangements and travel expense settlements
    • Handle internal and external correspondence and redirect as appropriate
    • General administrative support of team-members (room-reservation, purchasing of office supplies, office planning, ad-hoc support as requested)
    • Prepare reports, slides and graphic presentations as required
    • Organize management meetings & maintain minutes of the meetings
    • Take personal initiative to improve processes and develop new approaches to tasks
  • Contribution in small projects or Cross Projects

WORK EXPERIENCE

    • At least 5 years administrative and business support experience in fast-paced environment
    • Project Management Experience
    • Ability to coordinate meetings, communications, etc. across time international time zones
    • Experienced interacting with multiple organizational groups / persons
    • Broad knowledge of general business processes / practices
  • Demonstrated proficiency with MS Office Tools and SAP internal tools

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment apply now.

SAP’S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
Additional Locations: Virtual – USA

Apply for job

items.content:
Executive Assistant

Support
Anywhere
Company: Buffer
Full Time

Overview

More than 80,000 customers depend on Buffer, and we focus as much on  we work as  we build. We’re looking for an executive assistant to our CEO, , to create the ideal environment for calm, productive work. You’ll master systems, schedules, and projects, and filter out distractions so Joel can proactively focus on Buffer’s vision and future. Want to be the key element that takes Buffer to new heights? We’d love to hear from you!

howwhatJoel

FULL-TIME · REMOTE

More about the Executive Assistant role

This position provides all aspects of direct support and assistance to Buffer’s CEO, , as well as some administrative and organizational support for Buffer’s leadership team.

Joel

We’re looking for an intuitive, empathic and attentive team member. In a role that is loosely defined, the ideal candidate would read between the lines and proactively jump in to grab tasks to make Joel’s work and life easier, simpler and more focused.

In the best description we’ve read of this role, Michael Hyatt describes “an air-traffic controller for your life. Not just your business—your whole life.” The ideal teammate will be Joel’s air-traffic controller, coordinating all the needs and demands of his life.

You won’t get detailed instructions for every task. Instead, you’ll be an extension of Joel – thinking and acting on his behalf all day long, making him more productive than he could be alone by providing the kind of intuitive support he may not even know he needs!

On a day-to-day basis you will:
  • Proactively manage Joel’s workflow and priorities, including meetings, correspondence, and milestones.
  • Proactively manage a busy and complex calendar and partner with Joel to keep him on schedule.
  • Prioritize and partner with Joel to make sure that all key objectives are addressed and handled in a timely manner.
  • Set up meetings and calls, plan meeting agendas, take detailed meeting notes and follow up on CEO action items.
  • Help prioritize incoming communication in a high volume inbox, including drafting replies to e-mails
  • Help organize critical work projects. While a lot of this role supports others, you will also run some projects from start to finish and work closely on many strategic matters.
  • Communicate in person and through correspondence with high level contacts inside and outside the company such as partners, customers, and senior leaders.
  • Support Joel and the leadership team with travel arrangements and expenses.

    • Skills and experience we’re looking for:

    Ideally, we’re looking for someone who has some or all of the following as a background:

    • Past experience as a successful virtual assistant, executive assistant or office manager
    • Experience supporting a team and mastering a large number of tasks
    • General knowledge of travel industry such as flights, trains, rental cars, hotel and conference accommodations desired.
    • Comfort with a variety of office software tools like G Suite, Google Calendar, Todoist, Trello, Dropbox, and more.

      • Qualities and traits we’re looking for:
      • A super-organized, punctual, and proactive person who loves to coordinate and keep the trains running on time
      • Someone who thrives in a busy environment and loves taking on new challenges
      • Over-the-top written communication skills
      • Outstanding organization, prioritization, analytical, and anticipatory skills
      • Solid project management and problem-solving skills
      • Excellent attention to detail
      • An “introvert whisperer” with a high EQ and emotional awareness around different personality types
      • Confidence in holding someone accountable, even if they’re in an authority position

        • About Joel

        Joel founded Buffer in his bedroom and since then has been dedicated to making Buffer a leader in the social media space as well as a healthy, positive and safe working environment for the team.

        Originally from the U.K., Joel now lives in Boulder, Colorado and is enjoying life being close to the mountains to go skiing in the winter and mountain biking or hiking in the summer. Always keen to connect with the Buffer team, Joel keeps his Fridays open for anyone on the team to book office hours with him.

        Joel is also an  in 12 startups as he’s passionate about helping early-stage startup founders throughout their journey.

        angel investor

        What we value as a company

        Clear communication, , and empathy are just a few of Buffer’s . We are looking for a person who understands this culture and will thrive within a team of people passionate about self-improvement, honesty and openness.

        transparencycultural values

        Buffer is an  with teammates all around the world. We are actively working to create an inclusive environment and value diverse and non-traditional backgrounds. We’re united by Buffer’s values, and we celebrate our unique differences.

        equal opportunity employer

        Perks and Benefits

        We hope that you’re excited by all the possibilities that come with working at Buffer! In addition to our unique culture, we also offer these fun perks and benefits.

        • : Get hooked up with a laptop to do your best work.
          • Technology
        • : To encourage our teammates to be their best selves, we offer a monthly stipend for any course or training you’d like to do.
          • Learning & development stipend
        • : We offer health insurance for all of our team members, international and US based.
          • Health insurance
        • : Our salary formula adjusts to your cost of living and experience. For this role, the range is per year
          • Salary$67k – $85k USD .
        • : Live and work from wherever you feel happiest.
          • Work remotely
        • : Joining the Buffer journey means you can choose to own part of the company.
          • Stock options
        •  Our only policy is that you give yourself a break regularly enough.
          • Unlimited time off:
        • : Join us on annual international company retreats! Our last retreat was in Singapore.
          • Retreats
        • : We’ll send you free books and a Kindle, no questions asked.
          • Free books (and Kindle)
        •  If your family grows during your time at Buffer, we recommend taking 3 months of family leave, regardless of when you joined.
          • Family leave:

          Where You’ll Work

          Buffer is a fully distributed team, which means that we’re spread across the whole planet. We have Bufferoos across 15 countries, 11 timezones and 42 cities, scattered around the world to build a better culture and product. As a member in our team, you will work in the place that makes you happy, that inspires you daily, and helps you to become the person that you wish to be.

          More about how we work remotely →

          See where the Buffer team is now →

          Still reading? We want to hear from you!

          Answer a few questions about your experience and what you’d be excited to bring to the team at Buffer.

          Apply now

          Here’s our tentative transparent hiring timeline:

          • Apply to join our team!
            • August 24-Sept. 21 :
          • We’ll spend time reviewing applications and sending out follow-up questions and exercises.
            • 24- Oct. 5:
          • Follow-up interviews with the team.
            • 8-19:



            Let's do this! Apply for this job at the URL below.

            Please reference Jobspresso in your job application, so that remote companies know where their best candidates are coming from

            https://journey.buffer.com/executive-assistant/en →

items.title: mHealth Software Sales Executive (100% Commission)
items.content:
mHealth Software Sales Executive (100% Commission) at Delve Health

Minneapolis, Remote · Cofounder
Skills
Sales, Medical Devices, Life Sciences
Compensation
$120K–$200K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

Delve Health is a software development “start-up” company headquartered in Minneapolis, MN. We are currently launching a new Clinical Trial collaboration platform (powered by a mobile application) designed to connect the Sponsor, Investigator and Patient called StudyPal.

We need to complete a 90-day demo "blitz" - focused exclusively on Medical Device manufacturers (public/ private) who execute multiple clinical trials per year.

Do you have standing relationships with medical device manufacturers?
Do you have experience selling software solutions to Medical Device manufacturers?
Are you able to schedule a StudyPal "demo" with Clinical Trial Managers, Clinical Operations, VP – Operations or Marketing Managers or related areas?
If you answered "yes" to any of these questions...you could make some serious coin!

Quota - Commission - Bonus:

StudyPal is sold in a license “bundle” costing $24,950 (this is our minimum sale):

Individual sales goal is $200,000 during 90-day demo "blitz." (roughly 8 sales)
$100 per "qualified" StudyPal demo scheduled & executed
10% on first $75k of revenue (tier 1)
15% on second $75k of revenue (tier 2)
20% of all revenue achieved after $150k
plus, an additional $10,000 bonus to any rep exceeding $300k of revenue in 90 days!
This is a ground floor opportunity.

100% commission based contract positions - see structure in posting below
Short-term delivery targets
Team members will operate virtually, with weekly video conference meetings with VP – Sales & CEO
Successful candidates will be well positioned for full-time positions and equity participation
Product Offering: StudyPal is a mobile collaboration software platform designed to improve communication between Clinical Trial participants (Sponsor, Investigators & Patients). The solution is NOT a Clinical Trial Management System (CTMS) or Electric Data Capture (EDC) solution. Value proposition;

Sponsor : Mobile, Collaboration, Analytics, Reduce Study Costs, Auditable, Study Work Flow, Accurate, Multi-language
Investigator : Mobile, Accurate, Fast, Patient Enrollment, Patient Randomization, Easy, Educational, Auditable
Patient : Mobile, Accurate, Fast, Simple, Empowering & Educational
Training and Preparation: Delve Health will provide you with a web demo of the StudyPal platform and answer any questions so you will be able to make a proper pitch. We will also provide ongoing support, and closing resources to ensure the offering has been properly framed for the need.

Primary Function: Operate as part of a team for marketing, promoting and profitably selling products and services to new customers.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Seeks out prospective customers/business opportunities with new customers.
Work as a sales team member to develop a marketing strategy and plan.
Collaboratively develop and maintain a sales forecast to help analyze market conditions for maximum productivity and sales growth.
Implement individual sales plan to support sales and profitability goals.
Generate profitable sales orders.
Work remotely while maintaining a high degree of collaboration.
Makes personal sales calls.
Follow-up on all generated quotations to assure that the customer is being serviced and to document the outcome of the proposed solution.
Report competitive conditions and feedback from customers to management.
Execute sales efforts in an ethical and professional manner, assuring a favorable impression of self and the company.
Maintains a professional/working image
Qualifications:

Proven record of business development and sales within Medical Device verticle.
Bachelor's degree in business with an emphasis in sales and marketing; or closely related field with three years of relevant sales and industry experience; or equivalent combined education and on the job experience.
Commitment to and demonstration of high ethical standards governing professional behavior and interactions.
Technical fluency on social media platforms and basic CRM, as well as standard email and MS Office products.
Demonstrated time management and organizational skills.
Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly and concisely in written and verbal formats, including sales presentations
Demonstrated capability to develop strong interpersonal working relationships and work in a team environment.
Strong customer service orientation.
Read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, etc.
Requirements:

Must have a PC/ laptop with stable and functional internet.
Home office area, with full high-speed access and ability to run web cons and phone meetings professionally and reliably
Role is BYOD. Must have a functioning telephone.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=15, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Technical Project Manager

Company: Four Kitchens
Headquarters: Austin, TX
https://www.fourkitchens.com/careers/
Are you a CMS-savvy project manager who is a great listener and thrives on driving complex projects to success? Do you love to collaborate and facilitate communication between technical and business people? Are you excited by data-driven and detail-oriented planning? We want you to join our team of talented strategists, project managers, and project owners!

The Technical Project Manager role is ideal for a self-starter and who takes their responsibility for a project’s holistic success very seriously. A Technical PM is part digital strategist, part project owner, part account manager, and part project manager. Yes, that is a lot of parts!  

Responsibilities

  • Plan and monitor web projects for clients, resulting in on-time and on-budget delivery.
  • Understand and manage the staffing needed to complete a complex, multi-phase project effectively.
  • Lead project meetings based in the Agile/Scrum methodology.
  • Meet regularly with clients to discuss their needs and project status, address how out of scope requests will be addressed, and to remove project impediments.
  • Coordinate and facilitate the most effective set of touchpoints between client and development team to ensure efficiency, increase clarity, and resolve issues.
  • Navigate tricky conversations with clients regarding potential budget and/or timeline compromises.
  • Know enough about development tasks to help with prioritization and functional discussions.
  • Some travel for onsite project kick-offs with clients.
Qualifications

Essential

  • At least two years of project management experience working with large website projects.
  • Proficiency in JIRA.
  • Experience using the Agile/Scrum project management methodology.
  • Experience in a client services environment supporting multiple clients and projects across different industries.
  • Demonstrated initiative, follow-through, attention to detail, proactivity, and a proven history of delivering high-quality work.
  • Comfort with being the direct client contact, negotiating with stakeholders, and building rapport.
  • Desire to continually learn new technologies and processes and apply them where appropriate. 
  • Intellectual curiosity and passion for making really cool stuff for the web.
Bonus

  • Prior experience designing, theming, or developing for Drupal.
  • Prior experience as a project manager developing Drupal or Wordpress websites.
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher. (Why preferred rather than required? Experience and passion are more important, and being a constant self-educator is essential.)
Benefits

  • Generous time off policy. We plan for each team member to take up to 25 days of time off annually. Take time when you need it and own your destiny!
  • Paid holidays – including days such as MLK Day, 4K Founding Day, and a Winter Holiday (usually a full week).
  • $2,000 annual professional development and education budget. This can be spent on conferences, seminars, classes — anything that advances your professional goals.
  • 100% paid medical insurance for employee, including dental and vision.
  • 100% paid life and disability insurance for employee.
  • 3% Safe Harbor non-elective employer 401k contribution.
  • $150/month tech stipend to spend on your home office and equipment needs.
  • Flexible scheduling and working remotely.
  • An excellent work environment filled with smart, funny people who love what they do.
About Four Kitchens

Four Kitchens is a leading digital strategy firm with strong roots in the open-source and free-culture communities. We build websites and apps to engage audiences on virtually any device, in our pursuit of setting knowledge free. We hire developers, designers, and strategists with strong consultative skills and a desire to make a difference, both to our clients and to each other. 

Our Values and Culture

Our Web Chefs bring more than their professional skills to the kitchen and we encourage everyone to help guide the direction of our company. We all have a strong voice in what we do and how we do it. Collectively, our values—The Way Of the Web Chef—guide how we interact with each other, our colleagues, and our clients. Four Kitchens is not just a company — it's a closely knit team. We believe in the power of individuals coming together to do something bigger than they could have done alone. 

Distributed Work

We believe good talent is where you find it and, as a distributed team, we’re excited to be pioneers in what we believe is the future of work-culture. Even though we have no physical office, we strive to remain a collaborative community using tools like Slack and Zoom. The Web Chefs span four time zones and our goal is for team members to feel like they are working together in the same room, even if they're thousands of miles apart. 

Our Benefits

We care for our teammates as people, which is why we have a generous PTO policy, encourage time off, and have a great benefits package. Not only do we strive to maintain a good work-life balance, but we also participate in interesting and creative projects outside of client work to expand our abilities.

Contact us

Include the following materials with your application:

  • Resume/CV.
  • Cover letter. Tell us about which of our Core Values resonates with you the most and why!

Apply for this position

Visit our careers page to apply for this position.

items.content:
CMN Growth Executive


About Creative Mentor Network

Launched in 2015, Creative Mentor Network is a charity with a mission to make the creative world of work more diverse and inclusive through mentoring. We work with schools across London to connect talented 16-19 year olds from diverse backgrounds with those working in the creative industries.

We are working with some great partners across the creative industries - Havas, Soho House, ustwo, BBH, Pulse Films, Sony Music and Beggars Group amongst others.

Over our 16-week Mentor Training Course we train industry professionals as effective mentors and people managers. Our model is designed so that everyone wins: supportive careers guidance for students; training and development for mentors; access to diverse talent for creative businesses.



About the role

You’ll be at the heart of an initiative that will genuinely be making a difference to young people’s lives.

We need a powerhouse who can drive business development and marketing projects forward. We’re looking for someone who’s driven and not afraid of a challenge. The job is diverse and will evolve as we grow, which makes it a highly unique opportunity to develop and refine a valuable skill set.

We’re looking for someone who will take ownership of both CMN’s pipeline of leads to get more businesses to sign up as partners, and the digital communications to raise brand awareness.

We’re a small team, so general administrative support is a part of the role.

This is a 6 month contract role at the moment, but may turn into a permanent role. We are open to part-time and full-time set-ups. Our priority is our mission, not how you work.



Start date: ASAP

Salary: 18,000-24,000 depending on experience

Deadline: We want to find the right person as soon as possible. There’s no official deadline but we will begin interviewing as soon as applications start coming in.



Skills:

Highly organised with a proactive approach to improving processes
Tenacious approach to achieving targets
Friendly, personable and confident - you’ll be building relationships with clients.
Excellent copywriter with good understanding for a story
Good design skills and an ability to use social media tools. Working knowledge of Photoshop would be great but isn’t essential.


Experience and interests:

Demonstrated track record of achieving targets
Proof they don’t drop balls and can manage lots of work-streams at once
Passionate about diversity and inclusion issues and on top of relevant high profile discussions
Preferably prior experience working in any of - HR and recruitment, or PR and marketing


Operations:

CRM: Managing the CRM system and the pipeline of inbound leads from registering interest to ‘closing’ - following up with potential clients once they’ve met with CEO to book places on the course and bring partners fully on board
Relationships: Use your good relationship building skills to support the CEO to maintain good relationship with clients, ensuring they are happy with the service, and coming up with ways to upsell CMN services.
Systems: To build and maintain administrative systems that streamline our processes and make us more efficient, in collaboration with the team
Partnerships: Liaise with partners to galvanise them around the CMN cause, and ensure they commit to sharing content with their audiences.
Coordination and admin: Overseeing the onboarding of all mentors to make sure they are fully engaged in the programme. Invoicing and sending contracts to clients - being main point of contact for questions about the programme. General diary management for CEO, organising high profile speaking events, setting up phone calls and meetings.


Marketing & social media:

Planning: Contribute to and maintain a Communications calendar of activity for planning and scheduling.
Writing: Produce compelling and concise copy, acting as copy-editor for content being produced across the team and our network of contributors and young people.
Insights and research: Delving into diversity and inclusion debates, following current trends in youth creativity, public figures and reports. Working with CEO to include in opinion pieces for blog, CMN social channels and CEO’s opinion pieces.
Social media and e-comms: Take charge of social media and e-comms, working with the CMN team, mentor and mentee community to proactively document, develop engaging content for online (eg. high quality images, videos, blogs) and use it to raise brand awareness and to generate warm business leads.
Press: Liaising with trade magazines and general press. Telling the CMN story and packaging our content to grow our coverage in the media. You will be responsible for building a press list and developing good relationships with journalists.
Events: Supporting Youth Lead and CEO to programme and market events relevant to our community.


TO APPLY:

Please send a CV and cover letter of no longer than 500 words to isabel@creativementornetwork.org

items.title: Director of Global Partners
items.content:
At GoCardless we’re looking to scale from processing nearly £5 billion a year to over £10 billion. Our vision is to build a global connected payments network, making payments simpler no matter what country you're in or what software you are using.

GoCardless is building the world’s first payment network for bank-to-bank payments, to rival credit and debit cards. Our mission is to break down barriers, so businesses can take payments directly from customers’ bank accounts, anywhere globally, in any currency.

To further help us achieve this goal, we’re looking for a talented internationally experienced leader who will be responsible for building and rapidly growing GoCardless’ Partner Revenues globally through our rapidly growing Partner network.

In this new role, you will build a partner organisation based on International software vendors covering both SMB (eg Xero) and Global Enterprise (eg Zuora) as well as over 150 ‘local’ partners based in a specific territories. These organisations have, and will continue to have, significant impact on GoCardless’ revenues.

You will also be responsible for developing existing Partnerships whilst identifying both global and localised technology partners. Working with them to build joint GTM strategies and to deliver revenue.

You will manage and develop a team of Partner Development, Success, Marketing and Sales individuals to work through technology partners globally. Your team will initially span London and Paris with the potential growth across other territories such as Germany, Australia and USA.

As a Leader and part of our Sales Leadership Team we look for the courage and confidence to challenge the status quo; anticipating problems and mitigating risks.

*Who we’re looking for*

* Experience having led a fast growing International Partner Team for a Saas Software Company
* Built new revenue streams through a partner network globally
* Developed and led a portfolio of Global Partnerships which deliver fast growing revenue in multiple countries across Europe, North America and APAC
* Previously executed joint Go-to-Market strategies, regionally, locally (i.e. in country) and globally
* Attention to detail, and the ability to negotiate complex contracts with Partners.
* Comfortable managing remote Business Development, Marketing and Sales individuals - based in other countries or continents
* Strategic view of the business and experience of working at the Executive Board level cross functionally across the business to execute joint goals and plans
* Grown a significantly sized multi-country team of professionals
* Excellent presentation, interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written.
* A key decision Maker: you have excellent decision-making, analytical and problem solving skills, assessing the relative importance of activities and assignments and adjusting priorities when appropriate
* A Culture builder: You have motivation and flexibility to work well in a rapidly changing and fast-growing environment

Our team comes from a variety of backgrounds and we embrace diversity – if you’re unsure, please apply

items.title: Head of People Operations
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Head of People Operations


Acuity Scheduling, Inc.

Hi there,

I'm Gavin, founder and CEO at Acuity Scheduling.

I’m proud to say we’ve been helping small businesses manage their appointments for 11 years now. In that time, we’ve grown. What started with me pecking away at a keyboard all by my lonesome has turned into a company with nearly 40 employees scattered around the globe. And we’re continuing to grow at a healthy pace.

But I need your help.

We've been able to build a completely remote company with a phenomenal culture and happy employees. And I want Acuity to stay that way. It is deeply important to me that our people are happy — more important to me than just raking in profits. But people aren't my forte. And, as we grow, I'm being pulled in many different directions. So we need someone like you to work full-time to maintain our happiness.

Can you help us to continue to grow and to enjoy our jobs more?

**REQUIREMENTS**

Here's some of what you'll be expected to do:

* Think of new ways to delight remote employees
* Oversee our benefits and manage them in conjunction with Justworks (our PEO)
* Help ensure job postings and interviews are fair and inclusive
* Make sure new employees feel supported even before they start
* Work with other folks to organize company retreats
* Find ways to keep the pulse of employee morale
* Keep me informed of issues so we can solve them together
* You're all about ethics, and you want to be sure we're always on the right side of employment laws


Experience in these areas will help:

* You've helped other managers get better at their jobs
* You know your way around insurance (PPO, HMO, and POS are more than just letters slurped from your alphabet soup)
* Extending job offers is something you can do in your sleep
* You've helped terminate enough people to know how painful it can be, as well as what to do in advance to avoid surprises

**BENEFITS**

And by the way? These other qualities would probably help bucketsful:

* You’re in favor of having 100% of your medical, dental, and vision premiums covered.
* 401K is your middle name. (Or if you just really like the idea of having 3% of your salary contributed to one.)
* You’re an autodidact. Go on. Look it up. (You’ll get a $5,000 credit toward continuing your education.)

If this description sounds like you, there’s a chance that I’d like to offer you $80k-$115k, straight-up cash money. I mean, it’d be in exchange for your professional services each year, but still.

Write me. Or, you know, fill out the application that I will review personally.

cheers,

-Gavin

Location: United States

See more jobs at Acuity Scheduling, Inc.

items.content:
Engineering Manager - Android

About the RoleAt Hotstar, we have over 100 million users and capture close to a billion click stream messages daily. The engineering team at Hotstar is at the centre of the action and is responsible for creating unmatched user experience. Our engineers solve real life complex problems and create compelling experiences for our customers.In this role, we are looking for a leader who can own Android development throughout the planning, design and development lifecycle and help us craft unique and seamless user experience. The pace of our growth is incredible – if you want to tackle hard and interesting problems at scale, and create an impact within an entrepreneurial environment, join us!

Key Responsibilities

    • You will be responsible to architect solutions using innovative technology ideas and industry leading methodologies.
    • Lead from the front and architect the Android application to be modular and use best practices to enable rapid iteration.
    • You are required to keep abreast with emerging front-end and interactive technologies, promote their usage as project needs dictate and drive adoption across the company.
    • Work closely with Product Management, Vendors and other engineering leaders in cross functional capacity.
    • You will provide feedback to both designers and developers on technical feasibility, speed and optimization, and possible alternatives to difficult interactions or animations.
    • You will be responsible to mentor geographically distributed teams.
    • Provide thought leadership to team around new technologies, processes and approaches.

What to Bring

    • Must have excellent written and spoken communication skills.
    • Must have experience as a Android development lead with at least 3+ years as a leader.
    • Must have experience on TODO. Experience implementing solutions with APIs, RESTful web services & JSON.
    • Good Exposure to OO, Design Patterns and Data Structures.
    • Must have proven track record of delivery and leadership.

items.title: VP of Sales

items.content:
VP of Sales at Tamber

San Francisco, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$200K–$280K
0.0%–0.2%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

Looking for an expert sales person to join our team of programmers and bring the first deep learning powered personalization platform to the masses.

We have a super sticky product (0% churn) with fast growth and need you to help us scale up the top of our funnel, building repeatable lead gen + sales processes. You will be in control, and are expected to experiment.

Our priority is to move fast, so we are offering an unusual deal. You get 70% on the first year of margins from all sales you close, and 45% on the second year, with a $30M ceiling.

For a platform with 10M monthly-active-users that will come out to be ~$40-60k / year.

The baseline salary is $30k/year.

items.title: Chief Revenue Officer or VP of Sales
items.content:
Chief Revenue Officer or VP of Sales at IntellaSphere

Bellevue, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$120K–$200K
1.0%–3.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced sales leader to effectively drive IntellaSphere’s sales activities in order to maximize customer/subscriber acquisition. We’re looking for a highly motivated, hands-on sales rock star, who has broad experience growing sales with B2B SaaS-based software and/or a Digital Marketing Agency (preferably experience with both).

Our business is ready to take flight – so we are looking for someone who moves fast, is nimble, comfortable with digital marketing solutions, and has a strong desire to drive revenue and sales to the next level and be part of a winning team.

Job description

• Quickly learn, understand and be able to pitch IntellaSphere’s Integrated Marketing System.
• Create, communicate and execute on an effective sales approach and sales plan.
• Close sales of our full service marketing offering and help drive trial signups of our DIY SaaS-service offering.
• Manage all steps of the sales process / sales pipeline, from lead generation to nurturing to closing.
• Sell consultatively, assessing the prospective client’s needs and tapping into how our a multi-channel product suite can help them quickly grow their business.
• Conceptualize breakthrough sales strategies and programs that drive sales, as well as differentiate and advantage IntellaSphere.
• Serve as an sales ambassador / evangelist for the company. Instill confidence in and loyalty to our brand.
• Determine and optimize cost effective sales initiatives / programs.
• Build or better yet, leverage existing relationships at all levels, including small-to-mid-size businesses, digital marketers, marketing agencies and key industry influencers

items.title: Business Development Manager (A.I. & chatbots)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=6, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Contact us remotejobr->gmail.com

Business Development Manager (A.I. & chatbots)

Headquarters: Helsinki, Finland
URL: https://www.chatbotpack.com/

Chatbot Pack (www.chatbotpack.com) is a growing provider of customized enterprise chatbots & A.I. solutions. We invite you to join the new wave of Artificial Intelligence by applying for our open position of

Business Development Manager (chatbots & A.I services)

Artificial intelligence provides new opportunities in enhancing customer services, improving marketing,  inspiring customers and making operations more efficient. Chatbot Pack creates inspiring chat experiences through chat automation, chat robotics and chat staffing.

According to Facebook, 51% of consumers say messaging has replaced other communication methods. Therefore, more companies are embracing this shift in consumer habits by offering automated and live services in chat and messaging channels. Workplace chat applications, such as Slack and Microsoft Teams, embrace chatbots, and our tools will make internal operations more efficient.

Main responsibilities for this position are new business development, including identifying potential clients, prospecting and approaching business decision makers.

Why apply?

  • Join company culture encouraging creativity and communications
  • Be a pioneer in the Artificial Intelligence industry
  • Salary with a stimulating bonus structure
  • Longterm & full-time position

Responsibilities

  • Identifying potential clients and business opportunities
  • Approaching and finding decision makers
  • Demonstrating and convincing clients about the benefits of Chatbot Pack services and automation tools

Expectations

  • experience in business development or sales from the software or customer service industry
  • experience in working with distributed remote teams
  • excellent written and spoken English
  • familiarity with the benefits of instant messaging and chat platforms
  • understanding of the importance of quality service and good user experience
  • good persuasion skills through phone, video conferencing and email
  • knowledge about social selling and sales software tools
  • understanding and experience with Facebook advertising can be beneficial



To apply: Apply at https://www.chatbotpack.com/chatbot-jobs/
